This whole operation seems to have had totally different goals than the ones the teams were told.  The official story was, we would be going on a short trip to Proxima Centauri to get more Pentaxid to help Earth survive.

The fleet left the Jupiter orbit - forced by the Waverider Protocol as it seems - and ended up billions of light years beyond that point!  In Andromeda! 

The irregular Vortex we were dragged into might have been the reason for the passage to Andromeda.

A wavefront, which pushed us further than the warp drives could ever have achieved alone. It seems like this was finely planned up to the very second. Although I'm not sure if our little one-year delay was planned as well or just an accident either. 

As far as we know, the fleet was attacked immediately upon arrival here ..   which makes me think, those Zirax were waiting for them.  The sensors of the TITAN and GRAND detected the source of the anomaly in this system, but they had not time to investigate any further.

Vice Admiral Benner sacrificed himself to allow the GRAND and the other vessels to escape.

When the Elder Talon arrived in this unknown sea of stars, their failure in finding a new home world made them look for the next best alternatives.

Instead of a lush, water world, they made landfall on a dry, nearly deserted planet, consuming the last power units of their already severely damaged ships.

Left with the bare minimum, often not much more than what has been loaded to their escape vessels in a hurry, the Elder Talon survivors not only struggled with surviving the harsh environment, but also with rebuilding their society.

As a symbol of the past, demonstrating the will to stand their ground in this new world, the RHY'KAH Charged Crossbow, a former ceremonial weapon of the Academy Guards, became the symbol of these few, that made it over the dark, cold ocean of stars.

After having paid a high blood toll on their arrival and the first decades of surviving the harsh environments of their new home world, the new hope started to descend into darkness again.

Lacking the skills of their grandfathers that brought life to their planet, and lacking the technical understanding, for the ancient machines brought to the new world with these vessels, a rapid regression of culture and devolution of technology took place in only a few short generations.

The high civilization of the Elder Talon shattered into a batch of clans and a century of brotherhood wars began.

Although the Talon, as they now called themselves, were not able to repair the ancient machines, they were clever enough to create machines of war and death from their remains, like the Hata'M Charged Catapult.

After 1000 years, the darkness slowly came to an end. New inventions were made and the machines, that survived the battles, led the Talon into a new era of knowledge and prosperity.

Studying the ancient texts and remains of the old escape ships, made our great ancestors aware of their heritage, their former technical abilities and a legacy, they were willing to compete with.

While learning from old holo videos about the Academy of Sciences, which had ruled that distant galaxy they once fled from, and, although the most important info about the reason of the exodus from their original homeworld were missing - retrieved by scientists a few generations later - these Talon people, eager to mimic their mighty ancestors, formed the new Academy of Sciences and gave it a crucially different role: [b]The exploration and colonization of the stars.[/b]

After decades of expansion, the Talon were challenged by a federation of traders that tried to put their foot on all the Talon worlds. Never being the fighters, the Talon were on retreat from the beginning - until they found an emerging civilization that just made its first steps into deep space: The Zirax Empire.

Impressed by their assertiveness, and the Zirax, willing to benefit from the technological level offered in expense to defending the Talon Academy of Science, the Talon-Zirax Assembly was founded. After the war ended, the Talon-Zirax Assembly spread over the galaxy, encompassing thousands of worlds, peacefully ruling tens of species.

Then, all of a sudden, inhabited worlds fell silent. As they found out what was lurking in the dark, a shockwave went through the government and the Talon society in particular: The Legacy has followed them to this galaxy!

After we escaped with our bare lives, there was a lot of discussion about what the fleet should do next. The two Admirals, my father and anyone with any relevant info, was either lost or dead.  

After a few weeks it became clear, that we won't go back to earth anytime soon. So there was a fierce dispute on how to proceed. Although we had found a secret hiding place, some of the commanders and captains, led by Commander Lamarr, Commander Zerogen and others spoke to Vice Admiral Perez about supporting the local independence movement to find some allies and first and foremost gather more info that way, without running into the Zirax Empire again. 

But Perez did not want to risk anything until we had built up a solid base of operations in that sector. She was also much more in favor of establishing the plans for the 'Project Eden'. Finding a planet for us to live on - or for others that might follow us to Andromeda now or in the future. 

Anyways. As a result, Commander Lamarr and the others left the fleet and started the GLaD. I think, as things stand now, Perez is quite happy about that, because GLaD helped to lead the Zirax forces astray several times already. So, after misconceptions were ruled out on both sides, GLaD is now secretly working with the UCH fleet, nurturing the resistance movement of the Talon against the Zirax and trying to get hands on any info about our fate and what the hell is going on in this galaxy.

The Talon seem to have been refugees, fleeing from the Triangulum galaxy. Fleeing from something what we know as 'The Legacy'. 

After the Talon arrived in Andromeda, they fell back into barbary, but have made it back to space in a short amount of time. They found and raised the Zirax and because the Talon were more the brains than the muscles, the Zirax grew into the role of the latter. After some decades of peace, the War of Silence started when the Legacy managed to follow the Talon to Andromeda. 

We do not yet know how this happened and also not how the war actually ended, but as far as we can say, the outcome was that the Talon were nearly eradicated from Andromeda. Not by the Legacy, but by the Zirax.   You finding that cryogenized Talon prisoner named Kar'han indicates, that the Zirax turned against their century-long allies all of a sudden.

Taking all that into account, there is one thing that does not make much sense at least to us: The Talon seem to still be technically capable of doing next-to-magical things, but those that are capable are hiding their knowledge even from their own tribes. We have now been working with them for nearly a year, but they still keep it a secret, why they do not use their abilities to their full extent. If you ask me, this is a bit suspicious. As if they are waiting for something.

Mercer (Senior) is most likely dead. And his son .. no way. He did not even know what we were up to. It is someone else. Either working with or even from inside the UCH. Someone who seems to have gained a lot of influence in the last months. We had some company yesterday. They sedated us, but I heard they were speaking about us. And one of them was a terran. Without doubt. We will find that traitor. I now know his voice!

The name Kar'han is still well known in the tales of our tribe. He is known as The First Warrior, fighting the oppression of the Zirax back when the war of silence still raged.\n\nHe was arrested by Zirax officers and kept in the damaged underground cryo-containment facility. The facility destroyed itself when its prisoner woke up and the remaining systems detected the LEGACY infection.
Debriefing. Speak to the Talon chief.
Speak to the prisoner of the cryo containment facility
We should look for the spider creatures [c][ffffff]around the basement[-][/c] of the monument.
Let's find out what hides inside this tower..
[c][80ffff]Really abort the mission? Please confirm![-][/c]\n\nYou can start the mission via PDA (F1) at any time.

The Personal Data Assistant (PDA) not only keeps track of available missions and their progress , but also offers the Journey Book (tracking your story progress) and the Empyriopedia ([url=https://www.dict.cc/?s=encyclopedia]encyclopedia[/url] of names, creatures, vessels, features and more).

[i]**Disclaimer: Singleplayer missions MIGHT not work as expected in Multiplayer or Coop! They are designed for ONE player, if no other information is given! In MP you can choose missions from the GROUP/Faction mission tab. This specific tab is ONLY visible if the game is set up as a server/p2p-server game!**[/i]

[u]A. PDA LOG[/u]
[c][ffffff]In case you want to re-read a message or dialogue, you can find (all non-SKIPPED*) entries in the [-][/c][c][00ff2a]PDA LOG[-][/c][c][ffffff] with the following steps:[-][/c]

1. From the chapter list on the LEFT, select the HEADLINE of the currently ACTIVE mission (e.g. 'READ FIRST: PDA & PDA LOG' would be the headline of this chapter!)
2. Click on the button PDA LOG on the top right.

[i]*Check the JOURNEYBOOK 'READ FIRST' tab for more info on how to retrieve skipped mission text and dialogues![/i]

[u]B. CHAPTER/MISSION & ACTIVATION & REPLAYABILITY[/u]
 - The chapter list (left side) always shows all VISIBLE or PLAYABLE chapters. More chapters (missions) might become visible while you complete other missions or do certain things in the game!
- In case a chapter is visible but NOT playable, check its description text on the RIGHT! This will tell you what you need to do to activate or play the chapter (f.ex. to find a certain item or go to a specific place or complete another chapter/mission) Those requirements are listed in the lower part of the chapter descriptions.
- If a chapter is REPEATABLE, its conditions and count will also be displayed in that area!

[u]C. MISSION STRUCTURE[/u]
- A mission always has ONE CHAPTER headline and (often) several TASKS. The active/selected mission and its (completed and active) TASKS are visible in the list on the left.  
- Each task can have one or several ACTIONS. The actions are displayed on the right side when you click on a TASK in the list on the left side. A brief list of all the ACTIONS of a task can be found on the top center area when a TASK is selected.

[i][c][ffffff]>> Click on the 'THIS IS A TASK' entry in the list on the left to reveal more info about TASKS/ACTIONS! <<[-][/c][/i]

[u][c][ff7b00]IMPORTANT[-][/c]![/u]
Most of the actions can be solved manually in case something breaks. Just click on the checkbox in front of the broken action in the top-center list of the selected TASK to complete it. [c][ffffff]Please consider making a SAVE GAME BEFORE resolving the action (!!) and send it in together with bug report in the game forums over at [-][/c][c][fbff00]empyriononline.com[-][/c][c][ffffff]![-][/c]

The Personal Data Assistant (PDA) not only keeps track of available missions and their progress, but also offers the Journey Book (which is tracking your story progress) and the Empyriopedia (which is an [url=https://www.dict.cc/?s=encyclopedia]encyclopedia[/url] of names, creatures, vessels, features and more).

In case you missed or overlooked a message, you can review them later in the [c][00ff00]PDA LOG [-][/c](use the button on the top right). 

[c][fbff00]Exit the PDA when you have familiarized yourself with the overview[-][/c]
Click the [c][00ff11]X[-][/c] on the top right or [c][00ff11]ESC [-][/c]to exit the screen.

The [c][00ffff]status overview panel [-][/c]displays all inventory and personal status information - your health, wounds, hunger, etc.\n\nIn addition, if you suffer or benefit from any [c][00ffff]status effect[-][/c], hover over the status effect below the CHARACTER STATS section on the right side to get more info. Use the Empyriopedia to learn about medical items or find the required item in the Survival Constructor or other crafting machines.

Select the toolbar slot with the Survival Tool and change to Resource ([c][00ff11]RMB[-][/c]).
- Collect [c][fbff00]Plant Protein[-][/c] from plants. Point at them and press [c][00ff11]F[-][/c].
- Harvest [c][fbff00]Fiber [-][/c]from small trees. Point at them and shoot ([c][00ff11]LMB[-][/c]) when the [c][ffffff]crosshair turns red.[-][/c]

Note: Destroying harvestable plants will not let them regrow!
Collect the plant protein from plants nearby. \n\nCheck the Biologist's Guide in the Empyriopedia [c][00ff00]({keybind(PDA)})[-][/c] in case you need help with identifying the plants and their crops.

To collect fiber, shoot at some larger plants, small trees and some bushes with the Survival Tool being set to RESOURCE mode or by using a chainsaw.\n\nThere are also plants that give you fiber by harvesting them. Check the Biologist's Guide in the Empyriopedia [c][00ff00]({keybind(PDA)})[-][/c] to identify these plants.

Open the status overview panel [c][00ff00]({keybind(Inventory)}) [-][/c]and select the Survival Constructor from the TOP RIGHT.\n\nMake sure all resources are in the inventory on the left, then select the [c][fbff00]Bandages [-][/c]to start crafting.

The Survival Constructor only allows a limited amount of usable items.

Notes:
- When having started a crafting process, you cannot stop it.
- When the crafted item is available, it will be moved to the OUTPUT. You can use drag & drop to move it to the inventory.
- You can use any consumable item directly from the Output, from the inventory or from the toolbar by clicking on it with [c][00ff00]SHIFT + Right-Mouse-Button[-][/c].
Open the status overview panel [c][00ff00]({keybind(Inventory)}) [-][/c]and use the Bandage to heal the injury by clicking at it with [c][00ff00]SHIFT + Right-Mouse-Button (RMB)[-][/c].
For more information about medical status effects and medical items, check the Doctors Journal in the Empyriopedia [c][00ff00]({keybind(PDA)})[-][/c]
Collect some [c][e1ff00]Plant Proteins[-][/c] and craft an [c][e1ff00]Energy Bar[-][/c].

The SURVIVAL TOOL has three basic modes. 
- Defense
- Resource
- Salvage 

Change the tool modes with [c][00ff11]Right Mouse Button (RMB).[-][/c]
Shoot/use the tool with [c][00ff11]Left Mouse Button (LMB).  [-][/c]
[c][00ffff][-][/c]
[c][00ffff]Defense[-][/c]
Use this mode for defending against small animals. It is suggested that you walk around with Defense mode activated, as small spiders and insects may attack you. 
[c][00ffff][-][/c]
[c][00ffff]Resource[-][/c]
Use this mode for harvesting fiber from plants, wood logs from trees, extracting ore from the rocks lying around or drilling down to underground deposits. 

Note: make use of your personal drone ([c][00ff11]F5[-][/c]) for mining underground deposits to avoid getting trapped in a deep mining hole.
[c][00ffff][-][/c]
[c][00ffff]Salvage[-][/c]
Use this mode for recovering usable materials from wrecks. With the Survival Tool you cannot regain the full amount of materials or components, but only a fraction. 

If a red box lights up on the lower right, you will not get back any materials.
Search the area for the survival tool. Pick it up with F.
IDA is your Integrated Data Assistant. Check the CHARACTERS section in the Empyriopedia [c][00ff00]({keybind(PDA)}) [-][/c]for more info.
The detector can be crafted in the suits SURVIVAL CONSTRUCTOR
To equip a tool, weapon or other handheld devices, drag and drop them to a free slot in your toolbar

Use the Left-Mouse-Button ([c][00ff11]LMB[-][/c]) to scan the area for contacts. Several markers will pop up on your HUD for a few seconds. Use the detector again to make them visible again. 

Moving the [c][00ffff]crosshair [-][/c]on the marker of a scanned object within [c][00ffff]detection range[-][/c] (~300m for the handheld Detector) will reveal more info.

As soon as you were close enough to 'discover' a station or deposit, the marker will change its description and be permanently available on your map.
[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] There seems to be a [c][ffffff]console [-][/c]inside the shelter.\n\nFind and access it ([c][00ff11]F[-][/c]).
Exit the inventory screen, then fire the detector with the [c][00ff11]Left Mouse Button (LMB)[-][/c] to ping the area for signals.
To access an interactive station or for speaking to an NPC press [c][00ff11]F[-][/c] to access. \nUse the dialogue answers to progress through the conversation.
After the Portable Constructor is unlocked in the Techtree [c][4cd22e]({keybind(TechTree)})[-][/c] it can be crafted in the Survival Constructor

The Techtree has several tabs with different topics. Most terrain-placeable devices like the Portable Constructor are to be found in the MISC tab.\n\nIn case you have enough XP and earned enough Unlock Points, you can either use the [c][00ff11]UNLOCK [-][/c]button on the top right or simply [c][00ff11]double-click[-][/c] on a locked item to unlock it.

Go to the [c][ffffff]MISC tab[-][/c] and scroll down to the PORTABLE CONSTRUCTOR and [c][00ff11]Double-Click[-][/c] on it to unlock the device.

If you are not able to unlock the device, you might need to earn more [c][ffffff]Experience Points (XPs)[-][/c] in order to level up to earn more [c][ffffff]Unlock Points[-][/c].

Exit the screen when you are done.
Check the Empyriopedia ([c][00ff11]F1[-][/c]) to learn more about ores and ore-bearing rocks.

There are several devices that have crafting capabilities:
[c][ffffff]1. Survival Constructor [-][/c]
This one serves as a fallback and is always available from your suit
[c][ffffff]2. Portable Constructor[-][/c]
Allows to craft basic devices, for example for a base.
[c][ffffff]4. Small, Large and Advanced Constructors[-][/c]
Offer to craft more advanced materials and devices.
You can only use them on a Base or in a Capital Vessel
[c][ffffff]5. Mobile Constructors[-][/c]
Available for Small Vessels and Hover Vessels. They offer a limited range of basic and advanced templates to be crafted.
[c][ffffff]6. Furnace[-][/c]
Allows to smelt ores into ingots a lot faster than constructors. 
[c][ffffff]7. Deconstructor[-][/c]
Allows to break down devices into components
[c][ffffff]8. Food Processor[-][/c]
While the Portable- and Survival Constructor offer some basic food and medical items, the food processor can also create better meals and all advanced medical items

Move the Portable Constructor to a free slot onto your toolbar. \n\nFind a suitable place and press the [c][00ff11]L[-][/c][c][00ff11]M[-][/c][c][00ff11]B[-][/c] as soon as the devices' wireframe turns [c][ffffff]blue[-][/c].
You can change most of the buttons used in the game in the Options menu. \nPlease note that in tutorials and missions the game might refer to the default-keys used.

A fuel tank is required for a base using conventional power sources. 
When using solar panels, you need to add a Capacitor (solar) instead.

Fuel tanks, same as many other devices, come in different sizes, volumes and other parameters.

Check the Techtree ([c][00ff2a]F3[-][/c]) for the progression of materials and devices.
Generators are conventional power sources. They need fuel to be run.\nAs an alternative, solar panels can be used (But require a Capacitor(Solar) )
Looting wreckages, abandoned bases and stations is a good source of valuable materials! Watch out for containers, crates and cargo boxes!
Check the wreckage for anything of interest, like [c][ffffff]Containers [-][/c]or [c][ffffff]Personal Containers[-][/c].\n\nTake ANYTHING you find with you!

Note: Other than wreckages, stations and buildings often belong to one of the factions. 

If that is the case, opening a container might destroy your factions standing, reducing your reputation to an unfriendly or hostile level!  

Before opening a box or container, check your top center screen. A message will light up there in case you are about to ruin your faction standing.
'Looting' is the game term for moving items from outside your inventory over into your inventory. ;)
Use the [c][00ff11]arrow[-][/c] in the top right corner to move all items to your suit inventory.\n\nThen close the window.

Your suit inventory is limited in volume. Although there are possibilities to increase your transport capacity by using more advanced suits or transportation boosters, vessels allow to increase the transport capacity by far.\n\nWith the Logistic Network ([c][00ff11]F4[-][/c]) you can even transfer items from one inventory to another inventory without having to manually move each and every item through your inventory. Check the Empyriopedia (F1) for details about the Logistic Network.

We now have most of the materials to craft the devices we need to power the com station, but we are lacking a few [c][ffffff]steel plates[-][/c].

Use your Survival Tool's SALVAGE mode to [c][fbff00]retrieve some steel plates[-][/c] by shooting at the building blocks and devices of the wreckage.

[u]Tip:[/u] 
When the structural integrity fails and parts of a structure collapse, you can [c][ffffff]pick up the debris[-][/c] ([c][00ff11]F[-][/c]) for a short time! This will give you back a few of the components!

To capture a station and in order to make other devices like generators, turrets and even doors work, you need to place a core.\n\nUse the Portable Constructor and [c][fbff00]craft a Core[-][/c] from the [c][ffffff]DEVICES [-][/c]tab.

After you looted all containers, you should consider salvaging a wreckage for its building materials. Using the SALVAGE mode of the Survival Tool or a Multitool will return components, like steel plates and even more precious items.

Salvaging building blocks and devices from wreckages or stations without a [c][ffffff]core [-][/c]comes with a certain loss of materials in the process, what means that none of the handheld tools will guarantee a 100% return rate, but between 10% for the Survival Tool and up to 67% for a Multitool T2.  

For structures you own, what means for structures you put a core, the return rate is 100%, though.

You found a [c][ffffff]Motorbike [-][/c]in the wreckage.\n\nMove the bike to a free slot in your toolbar and place it on the ground by pressing [c][00ff11]L[-][/c][c][00ff11]M[-][/c][c][00ff11]B[-][/c].

A core is required for any vessel or station to work. Without a core, all the devices will fall silent or refuse to work.\n\nWhen starting a new base or vessel, the different starter blocks come with a core built in.
Put the core to a free slot onto your toolbar and select it.\n\n[c][fbff00]Place the core[-][/c] onto the base when its [c][ffffff]outline [-][/c]becomes [c][ffffff]BLUE[-][/c].

For starting your own base or vessel from scratch, craft a Base Starter or Hover Vessel Starter with the Portable Constructor. \n\nStarters for Small Vessels and Capital Vessels are available from more advanced constructors!

This station now belongs to you! 
[c][fbff00]Point at[-][/c] any of the base blocks or devices and[c][fbff00] open the Control Panel[-][/c] ([c][00ff11]P[-][/c])

Tip: Starting a base from scratch requires a base starter to be crafted and placed.
You can now also access its CONTROL PANEL ([c][00ff11]P[-][/c]) which will offer several performance settings and important statistic details!

The CONTROL PANEL offers several performance settings and important statistic details.

For example the DEVICE tab is telling you, that your base is still missing several important devices, like a fuel tank and a generator.

For the next step [c][fbff00]close the Control Panel[-][/c] and [c][fbff00]open the Techtree[-][/c] ([c][00ff11]F3[-][/c]) again.

In case you do not have enough Unlock Points to unlock a device, you need to earn XP, for example by running missions, killing enemies, mining or farming to increase your player level. Each player level will reward you with more Unlock points you can spend on the Techtree.

Go to the [c][ffffff]BASE [-][/c]tab and find the [c][ffffff]Fuel Tank (T1)[-][/c] and the [c][ffffff]Small Generator[-][/c] and unlock them.

Both devices require Unlock points and a Player Level 3! If you haven't reached that level yet, you can level up by mining ores and harvesting plants. 
[c][fbff00][-][/c]
Either [c][00ff11]double-click[-][/c] on them or use the [c][00ff11]UNLOCK button[-][/c] on both devices to proceed.
The Small Generator can be found in the BASE tab.
The Fuel Tank (T1) can be found in the BASE tab.
Craft a [c][ffffff]SMALL GENERATOR[-][/c] and a [c][ffffff]FUEL TANK (T1)[-][/c] from the DEVICES tab in the [c][ffffff]Portable Constructor.[-][/c]

Instead of using the POWER slider, pressing[c][00ff2a] Y[-][/c] while standing on a base block achieves the same.\n\nThe management in the Control Panel is more useful when you want to switch different device groups on and off individually, as the Y-button only works as a general switch.

BioFuel is the easiest fuel to be crafted. You just need some fiber collected from plants or harvested from small bushes. BioFuel canisters hold only a few fuel points per item.\n\nEnergy Cells (small and large) and Fusion Cells can hold more fuel points per item.

With the '[c][00ff11]Connect to Base[-][/c]' (N) setting you can place devices onto a base without the requirement to touch the core or having to build a base-plate or a floor to place these devices onto.  \n\nWithout the 'Connect to Base' being activated (default setting) you can place devices only onto blocks that are connected to the core.
Conventional generators require fuel tanks to be filled with either BioFuel, Small or Large Energy Cells or Fusion Cells. \n\n[c][fbff00]Access the Portable Constructor.[-][/c]
Move the [c][ffffff]BioFuel [-][/c]to your [c][ffffff]inventory[-][/c].\n\n[c][fbff00]Point at any base block[-][/c] and press [c][00ff2a]P[-][/c] to open the [c][ffffff]Control Panel[-][/c].
There are two methods to refill any tank: Either by approaching the tank and pressing F or using the tank management of the Control Panel (P).
[c][fbff00]Drag & drop[-][/c] the BioFuel onto the '[c][ffffff]FILL FUEL[-][/c]' intake.\n\nAfterwards, open the [c][fbff00]Control Panel [-][/c]again.
With any fuel except BioFuel you can use the REFILL button below the tank display. Same applies to refilling O2 and Pentaxid.
Drag and drop the Detector from the [c][ffffff]Survival Constructor Output [-][/c]in a free slot onto your toolbar and select it.
Craft a [c][ffffff]Portable Constructor[-][/c] in the Survival Constructor\n\nWhile waiting for the crafting to complete, explore the surrounding area, harvest more plants and gather more resources!

The motorbike is the first vessel you can craft. It does not offer any additional transport capacity but driving it is at least a lot faster than walking..\n\nNote: The bike will fold into a 'power save' state after a few minutes. You can simply pick it up and place it again to unfold it.

Point at the motorbike and press [c][00ff11]F[-][/c] to mount it.
Use [c][00ff11]W[-][/c],[c][00ff11]S[-][/c],[c][00ff11]A[-][/c],[c][00ff11]D [-][/c]to drive and steer the motorbike.

Drive[c][fbff00] back to the Damaged Com Station[-][/c] when you are ready.
Please use the RESOURCE MODE of the Survival Tool.\n\n[c][fbff00]Gather 3 Iron Ore[-][/c] by shooting at the blue-ish looking, iron-bearing rocks.

Move the [c][ffffff]Small Generator [-][/c]in a free slot onto your toolbar. Then look at the base and open the Debug Menu ([c][00ff2a]N[-][/c]). Check the '[c][00ff2a]connect to Damaged Com Station[-][/c]' checkbox and close the menu ([c][00ff11]N[-][/c]).\n\nPlace the device anywhere [c][fbff00]away from the base [-][/c]NOT touching any base blocks!
To power up the station you need to craft a Portable Constructor at first.\n\nOpen the Techtree [c][4cd22e]({keybind(TechTree)})[-][/c].
You can use the Survival Tent  to sleep for 8 hours.
The Survival Tent serves as a RESPAWN point. (All modes: Single- & Multiplayer)

Move the Survival Tent to a free slot onto your toolbar, find a suitable place and press [c][00ff11]LMB[-][/c] when its wireframe turns blue. Press [c][00ff11]RMB[-][/c] ahead of placing to choose from some[c][ffffff] variants[-][/c] of the tent.\n\nYou can use the Survival Tent to sleep 8h.
[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] There is a settlement. \n\nApproach with caution. We do not know if they are friendly.
Weapons are unlocked in the WEAPONS tab. Some can be crafted in the Portable Constructor. Advanced weapons might need a Small, Large or even Advanced Constructor.
When unlocking any weapon, you are receiving the recipe for crafting the appropriate ammo AUTOMATICALLY. You do not need to unlock it separately.
Hover over the template in the constructor to see which ammo is required.

Ammo for handheld weapons need to be carried in your inventory (not onto the toolbar). 
It is reloaded from there automatically.

You can of course also reload manually by pressing [c][00ff11]R.[-][/c]

Weapons are to be found in the WEAPONS tab.

The [c][ffffff]PISTOL[-][/c] is already unlocked. 
The required ammo will be unlocked automatically.

I suggest to spend a moment checking which weapons might be available or unlockable in addition.
The first thing you should do with the Portable Constructor is to craft a better weapon. \n\nPlease open the Techtree ([c][00ff11]F3[-][/c]) again.
Find the chief in the largest building of the settlement.
Follow the marker pointing in the direction where IDA might have found some settlements.
Find the trader in the settlement and get the gear the chief has promised.
Go to the Ancient Tower and clear the area from the creatures spawning there.
Escape from the underground complex. Search for weak spots in the entry room.

[c][00ff11][Talon Chief][-][/c] Before we talk, you should see the [c][fbff00]Shaman [-][/c]to cure your injuries.  

Turn left when you leave this hall and then go straight ahead. 
You will notice when you find him.
You can find the shaman behind the main building.

The cauldron acts as a Talon variant of a constructor or food processor. It can craft most of the medical items you might need.\n\nNote: Taking stuff from barrels, containers or other storage devices from any factions bases or stations that are not explicitly allowed to be opened, might be still seen as stealing. This can lead to dropping your reputation to unfriendly and hostile! The UI will display a [c][ff0000]RED WARNING[-][/c] on the top center screen to let you know when you are NOT allowed to access a container.
More info about the different status effects and their remedies can be found in the Empyriopedia ([c][00ff11]F1[-][/c])
Get your gratification. Speak to the Blacksmith.

The resources and components required for items are always placed in a container. This container is then assigned to a crafting station, for example a constructor or a food processor.

All constructors, except terrain-placeables, require a storage container of any kind to be assigned.
You can have different storage locations for Inbox and Outbox!

[c][ffffff]Put all the ingredients into the barrels[-][/c].  The cauldron is linked to the barrels and will use all resources for the crafting process from there. It will also put the results of the crafting process right there.\n\nNow [c][fbff00]access the cauldron[-][/c] next to the barrels.

On the right side there is a list with food and medical templates you can craft.  Use the filters on top of the TEMPLATES headline to switch through them. \n\nCraft 1x  [c][fbff00]Antibiotic Pills[-][/c].

There are different types of medical items. Some can heal the injury directly. Others may not help directly, but slow down the process and give you more time to find the right remedy. For more information, see the item hover info.

Some consumables, like honey have a direct effect on your health without crafting.

[u]Waiting too long with curing a disease[/u] might lead to it turning into its more dangerous stage.
On the other side, curing some diseases might spawn side effects.

Check the Empyriopedia ([c][00ff11]F1[-][/c]) for more details.

You can access the assigned container inventory ..
1. EITHER by clicking on the [c][00ff11]icon next to the INBOX dropdown[-][/c] 
2. OR you can exit this window and access the container inventory directly ([c][00ff11]F[-][/c]) to put stuff inside or take items from it
3. OR you can press [c][00ff11]F4 [-][/c]and access the container inventory via the Logistics Menu.

More info about the Logistics Menu and how to work with the Logistics System are available in the Empyriopedia ([c][00ff11]F1[-][/c])

Access the Barrels either directly ([c][00ff11]F[-][/c]) or from within the crafting menu by clicking on the [c][00ff11]Container Access button[-][/c] next to the '[c][ffffff](A) Potion Station Storage[-][/c]' dropdown.
Hold [c][00ff11]SHIFT [-][/c]and make a [c][00ff11]R[-][/c]ight [c][00ff11]M[-][/c]ouse [c][00ff11]B[-][/c]utton click on the [c][ffffff]Antitoxic Ointment[-][/c] to apply it.

Traders offer and sell items, devices, resources and everything else you might want to buy or sell.
Not all traders sell or buy all items. Some are specialized, others might only buy or sell certain items. 
Traders usually accept money cards (CASH) or payment from your bank account. 

The official Trading Stations on orbits and on planets often have several traders which buy and sell a big range of devices.

Watch out for local traders on stations and outposts. They often buy commodity items for a good price!

Important
- You need to be at a [c][ffffff]neutral state[-][/c] with the faction to start buying or selling items.
- Find an [c][ffffff]ATM [-][/c]device in a trading station to add or withdraw money cards from your bank account.

Hello friend, you seem to be in a bad shape! 
Have these [c][fbff00]ingredients [-][/c]and head back to our [c][fbff00]shaman[-][/c].

[u]In case you need something else:[/u] All my trading goods can be found in the list on the right.

1. Select an item from the list on the right ( [c][00ff11]L[-][/c]eft [c][00ff11]M[-][/c]ouse [c][00ff11]B[-][/c]utton )
2. Add the number of items you want to buy or sell in the [c][ffffff]QUANTITY [-][/c]box at the lower left.
3. Select a payment method by checking either the [c][ffffff]CASH [-][/c](money cards) or [c][ffffff]BANK ACCOUNT[-][/c] checkbox at the lower left.

Press the [c][00ff11]BUY[-][/c] or [c][00ff11]SELL button [-][/c]to initiate the transaction.
Traders and NPCs that have something to say are marked with a yellow arrow floating above their heads.\nThe same is true for consoles that you can interact with!
[c][00ffff][Shaman][-][/c] There are three barrels to your right, next to a cauldron.\n\n[c][fbff00]Access the barrels[-][/c] ([c][00ff11]F[-][/c])
Speak to the chief. He resides in the largest building.
[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] You should [c][ffffff]speak to the chief[-][/c]. \n\nI assume he resides in the [c][ffffff]largest building[-][/c] in the center of the settlement.
Removing the [c][ffffff]Dermal Parasites[-][/c] leaves behind an [c][ffffff]Open Wound[-][/c].\n\nApply a [c][fbff00]Bandage [-][/c]to treat this injury, then speak to the Chief.

Constructors have a range of [c][ffffff]tab groups icons[-][/c] directly above the [c][ffffff]TEMPLATES[-][/c] headline. 
Each tab offers a different group of devices and components. 
Click on an icon to show the available templates of this tab group. 

You can also use the [c][ffffff]filter[-][/c] icons (adds a filter onto the selected tab-group) and the [c][ffffff]filter-textbox[-][/c]!

[u]Info:[/u]
[c][ff7b00]Red [-][/c]templates = you do not have enough resources or a particular component is missing
[c][00ffff]Blue [-][/c]templates = you need to unlock the device, tool or block in the Techtree (F3) at first.

Click on the [c][fbff00]icon [-][/c]of the [c][fbff00]WEAPONS & ITEMS[-][/c] tab above the [c][ffffff]TEMPLATES [-][/c]headline.

Move all resources from your inventory to the Portable Constructor INPUT ( [c][00ff11]SHIFT [-][/c]+ [c][00ff11]L[-][/c]eft [c][00ff11]M[-][/c]ouse [c][00ff11]B[-][/c]utton), then click on the [c][ffffff]Pistol [-][/c]and [c][ffffff]Pistol Round[-][/c] templates in the list to add the recipes to the crafting queue.

[u]Note:[/u]
If you do not have enough resources, the template will be red.
Hover over the template to learn which resources or components are missing.

[u]Tip:[/u]
You can add more than one template at the same time by pressing the[c][00ff11] LEFT MOUSE BUTTON[-][/c] while holding either [c][00ff11]SHIFT [-][/c](x10), [c][00ff11]CTRL [-][/c](x100) or [c][00ff11]CTRL+ SHIFT [-][/c](x1000).

Click on the [c][00ff11]INFO icon [-][/c]below the TEMPLATES list to learn more about constructors and crafting!
If you want to learn more about how to handle constructors, click on the [c][00ff11]INFO button[-][/c] right below the templates list!

Craft [c][fbff00]1x Biofuel[-][/c] from fiber from the [c][ffffff]COMPONENTS[-][/c] tab.\n\nTip: If you want to learn more about how to handle constructors, click on the [c][00ff11]HELP icon [-][/c]right below the templates list!

You can add more than one template at the same time by pressing the[c][00ff11] LEFT MOUSE BUTTON[-][/c] while holding either [c][00ff11]SHIFT [-][/c](x10), [c][00ff11]CTRL [-][/c](x100) or [c][00ff11]CTRL+ SHIFT[-][/c] (x1000).\n\nClick on the [c][00ff11]INFO icon [-][/c]below the TEMPLATES list to learn more about constructors and crafting!

[c][00ffff][IDA] [-][/c]This might have been one of the warriors from the lost expeditions. He looks .. infected. There could be more of them.\n\nQuick-Loot his pockets by using [c][00ff11]SHIFT-F.[-][/c]

[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] Commander I suspect this chamber might have been part of a cryo-facility which was destroyed ages ago. We might have awoken the station with our investigations .. including its inmate.\n\nYou should try speaking to him!

The UCH Protocol 001 A, also known as the 'Robinson Protocol' will help you to get started when crashing on an unknown planet. Follow the orders of your suit AI to succeed!\n\n[c][00ffff]Part II[-][/c] will teach you how to set up a camp, loot POIs, use the Techtree, using the Portable Constructor as well as the basics for your own permanent base.

The UCH Protocol 001 A, also known as the 'Robinson Protocol' will help you to get started when crashing on an unknown planet. Follow the orders of your suit AI to succeed!\n\n[c][00ffff]Part I will teach you the most basic survival mechanics.[-][/c]

[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] Commander! My efforts to reestablish communication with the fleet have failed, but I am tracking a weak signal of an UCH beacon nearby.\n\nFirst you need to [c][ffffff]craft a DETECTOR[-][/c] in your Survival Constructor!

[c][ffffff]Now DEACTIVATE [-][/c]the 'Connect to Damaged Com Station' checkbox ([c][00ff11]N[-][/c]) and find a spot for the[c][fbff00] Fuel Tank (T1)[-][/c] where its wireframe becomes blue.\n\nYou may note, that with the CONNECT mode [c][ffffff]deactivated[-][/c], you can place blocks and devices only in certain spots [c][ffffff]ONTO an existing base plate[-][/c] or base block.

NOTE: You need to [c][fbff00]deactivate that mode[-][/c] before trying to place something on terrain, like a Portable Constructor, Survival Tent and similar! In case you see an error or a wireframe not turning blue, check the Debug Menu ([c][00ff11]N[-][/c]) if the 'Connect to Base' is still active!

[b][c][00ffff]Chapter 1: Tales of the Past[-][/c][/b]

Find one of the tribal [c][ffffff]Small Settlements[-][/c] and make contact with the natives and learn something about this planet.

It might be vital for your journey .. and beyond.

[i]Location: Starter Planet; Ellyon System (Starter System)[/i]
[i]Reputation: Requires at least a [c][ffffff]neutral [-][/c]standing with [c][ffffff]Talon[-][/c][/i]

[i]---[/i]

[i][c][ff7b00]Problem with the mission?[-][/c] Write an email to [c][ffb875]mission@empyriongame.com[-][/c] or contact us in the forum at [c][ffb875]empyriononline.com[-][/c]![/i]

[c][00ffff][b]Chapter 2: Crashed Bird[/b][-][/c]

The Talon have given you the coordinates of a large [c][ffffff]wreckage [-][/c]of yet unknown, but presumably UCH origin. 

Follow the yellow '[c][ffffff]wreckage[-][/c]' marker and you will possibly find a trace of your fellow comrades.

[i]Location: Starter Planet; Ellyon System (Starter System)[/i]

[i]---[/i]

[i][c][ff7b00]Problem with the mission?[-][/c] Write an email to [c][ffb875]mission@empyriongame.com[-][/c] or contact us in the forum at [c][ffb875]empyriononline.com[-][/c]![/i]

[c][00ffff][GLaD][-][/c] We've got reports that this Polaris mining facility has found something interesting.
[c][ffffff][u]Your mission[/u][-][/c]: Retrieve that information so we can investigate them further.

[c][ffffff]Park your vessel on or in range of the upper pad.[-][/c]
Then go to the [c][ffffff]Landing Permission Signal[-][/c] to update the mission.

Any structure or POI (point of interest) you have captured can be rebuilt and upgraded to your needs - in case you do not want to start from scratch.

In general there are several ways to build a base or a vessel.

1. Craft a [c][00ffff]STARTER BLOCK[-][/c] for either structure type and build from the ground up, block by block.
2. Find a damaged vessel or base, put your own core and repair it up to a usable point.
3. Use the [c][00ffff]BLUEPRINT LIBRARY & FACTORY[-][/c] ([c][00ff11]F2[-][/c]) to print a prefab.  

[u]About using the BP LIBRARY AND FACTORY:[/u]
1. Open the [c][00ffff]BLUEPRINT LIBRARY[-][/c] by pressing [c][00ff11]F2.[-][/c]
2. Select the [c][00ffff]STOCK [-][/c]icon on the top left filter icons group.
3. Select the prefab blueprint that fits your needs
4. Click on it and select [c][00ff00]TO FACTORY [-][/c]and the view will switch to the factory view.
5. In the Factory, add all the required materials to the intake and hit START PRODUCTION.
6. Wait until the product is ready ( a message will pop up on the top right! )
7. Open the BLUEPRINT LIBRARY: You will find the finished base or vessel at the top of the list
8. Select it and spawn it.

When spawning, use [c][00ff00]PAGE UP / PAGE DOWN[-][/c], [c][00ff00]HOME / END[-][/c] and [c][00ff00]INSERT / DELETE[-][/c] buttons to adjust the spawning position of the vessel

[c][ffffff]Knowledge:[-][/c]
[c][ffffff]- You can not only add ingots, but also devices and blocks that are using these ingots in their template[-][/c]
[c][ffffff]- You can add items and devices from your CONNECTED TOOLBAR as well!
- Adding devices instead of ingots will CUT DOWN the production time![-][/c]
[c][80ffff]Really abort the mission? Please confirm![-][/c]\n\nYou can start the mission via PDA (F1) at any time.

The UCH Protocol 001 A, also known as the 'Robinson Protocol' will help you to get started when crashing on an unknown planet. Follow the orders of your suit AI to succeed!\n\n[c][00ffff]Part III[-][/c] will teach you how to use the map, set up your base, improve your crafting possibilities and how to mine underground deposits.
Use the ramp and go down to the subterrain levels.

[c][00ffff][IDA] [-][/c]That lever does not only seem to have switched on the lights. My sensors are picking up raising power levels a few meters further down.   \n\nI suggest to [c][fbff00]find the source[-][/c] .. with maximum caution.

[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] This part of the tower seems to be made from a different material. The traces indicate the material had to withstand extremely high temperatures.\n\nSomething is moving down here
Investigate the inside of the Ancient Tower
Find the source of the raising power levels. Expect enemy contact.
Head back to the Talon village and search for help for curing the Dermal Parasite.
[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] Commander, the explosion might have weakened some of the plates on the walls in the entry room. \n\nCheck them for cracks.

For all the devices we need to craft in order to make the Com Station a real base, we need to find a valuable source of resources: [c][ffffff]underground deposits[-][/c].

That's how you spot those deposits in case you did not yet detect them:
- Walk around with your Survival Tool or Drill in your hand OR use your Detector to find a [c][00ffff]Iron, Copper[-][/c] or [c][00ffff]Silicon[-][/c] deposit nearby.
- In case you only get a [c][00ffff]< Resource >[-][/c] marker instead of the resource type being revealed, go closer than 300m and scan again OR point at the marker with the Survival Tool or a Drill in your hand.

[c][fbff00]Go to any deposit.[-][/c]

That's how you spot those deposits in case you did not yet detect them:

- Walk around with your Survival Tool or Drill in your hand OR use your Detector to find a [c][00ffff]Iron, Copper[-][/c] or [c][00ffff]Silicon[-][/c] deposit nearby.

- In case you only get a [c][00ffff]< Resource >[-][/c] marker instead of the resource type being revealed, go closer than 300m and scan again OR point at the marker with the Survival Tool or a Drill in your hand.

Mine at least [c][fbff00]15 ores[-][/c] of [c][ffffff]Iron[-][/c], [c][ffffff]Silicon [-][/c]and [c][ffffff]Copper [-][/c]to start with.

You should of course get more, but pay attention to our mass/volume limitation of your backpack! ([c][00ff00]Tab[-][/c])

Knowledge:
- Use your PERSONAL DRONE ([c][00ff11]F5[-][/c]) while having selected a DRILL or the SURVIVAL TOOL (Resource Mode) in your toolbar! 
- You can remote-mine with your drone in a range of up to about 60 meters.
- The PERSONAL DRONE can be used for many other tasks and with other tools and gadgets as well!

Use your PERSONAL DRONE ([c][00ff11]F5[-][/c]) while having selected a DRILL or the SURVIVAL TOOL ([c][00ff11]Drill Mode[-][/c]) in your toolbar! \n\nYou can remote-mine with your drone in a range of up to about 60 meters.
The PERSONAL DRONE can be used for many other tasks and with other tools and gadgets as well!
More info about mining and resources can be found in the Empyriopedia ([c][00ff11]F1[-][/c]).
Head back to the base and put all materials into the [c][ffffff]Portable Constructor[-][/c].\n\nYou might also need additional materials such as Fiber and Crushed Stone.

In case you do not spawn a base or vessel from the Blueprint Library/Factory ([c][00ff11]F2[-][/c]), the Portable Constructor is the basic device you need in order to be able to upgrade your base to a more functional emplacement.

In addition to a [c][ffffff]Core[-][/c], a [c][ffffff]Generator [-][/c]and a [c][ffffff]Fuel Tank[-][/c], which are the required devices to run a base or vessel at all, there are several other basic devices that will improve the viability of your emplacement, opening up more possibilities, improved shelter and defense capabilities.

Craft a [c][fbff00]Small Constructor[-][/c] and a [c][fbff00]Cargo Box[-][/c], equip them to your [c][ffffff]toolbar [-][/c]and [c][fbff00]place them onto the base[-][/c].

You might need to unlock them from the Techtree ([c][00ff11]F3[-][/c]) at first.

Tip: you can either enlarge the base plate (craft and place Wood, Carbon or Steel Blocks and place them) OR you can use the Build Helper 'Connect to base' ([c][00ff11]N[-][/c]) to place the devices anywhere on the ground.
The Small Constructor is the most important basic base device.
You do not only need containers for storage BUT they are also required for the Constructors to work!

Constructors need to be linked to a cargo unit to be able to work.

To do that, click on the [c][ffffff]dropdown [-][/c]next to the [c][00ffff]INPUT [-][/c]on the [c][ffffff]top left [-][/c]and select a container from the dropdown to connect the production logistics of this constructor.

[u]Note:[/u] 
Click on the [c][00ff11](!) Help button[-][/c] above the CONSTRUCTION QUEUE to learn more about how to add materials, retrieve crafted devices, the Logistic Network and more!

Constructors need to be linked to a cargo unit to be able to work.

To do that, click on the [c][ffffff]dropdown [-][/c]next to the [c][00ffff]INPUT [-][/c]on the [c][ffffff]top left [-][/c]and select a container from the dropdown to connect it to the production logistics of this constructor.

NEXT: To improve the defense capabilities of the emplacement, craft and place a [c][fbff00]SENTRY GUN[-][/c] and an[c][fbff00] AMMO BOX[-][/c] . 

[u]Note:[/u] 
Click on the [c][00ff11](!) Help button[-][/c] above the CONSTRUCTION QUEUE to learn more about how to add materials, retrieve crafted devices, the Logistic Network and more!
Ammo for turrets and sentries needs to be put into an Ammo Box or an Container Controller (Ammo). \nThe devices will reload from there automatically!

Note that the ammo always needs to be put into the Ammo Box. 
The turrets will reload from there automatically. 
Adding ammo to a non-ammo container/box will not work.

For your personal protection, you should now [c][fbff00]craft and place[-][/c] an [c][fbff00]Armor Locker[-][/c] to equip and modify your armor suits.

[u]Tip:[/u]
Open the Control Panel ([c][00ff11]P[-][/c]) and click the [c][00ff11]FILL ALL[-][/c] button below the AMMO list. This will put any matching ammo from your inventory to the ammo boxes of our base.

You an use this [c][ffffff]shortcut [-][/c]for refilling ammo: Open the [c][00ff00]Control Panel (P)[-][/c] and click the[c][00ff00] FILL ALL [-][/c]button.\nThis will put any matching ammo from your inventory to the ammo boxes in our base.
Use [c][00ff00]PAGE UP/DOWN[-][/c], [c][00ff00]HOME/END[-][/c] and [c][00ff00]INS/DEL[-][/c] buttons and [c][00ff00]Mouseview [-][/c]to rotate and adjust the position of devices when placing.

Use [c][00ff00]PAGE UP/DOWN[-][/c], [c][00ff00]HOME/END[-][/c] and [c][00ff00]INS/DEL[-][/c] buttons and [c][00ff00]Mouseview [-][/c]to rotate and adjust the position of devices when placing.\n\nPlace on any base block OR  use the Build Helper 'Connect to base' ([c][00ff11]N[-][/c]) to place anywhere on the ground.
Use [c][00ff00]PAGE UP/DOWN[-][/c], [c][00ff00]HOME/END[-][/c] and [c][00ff00]INS/DEL[-][/c] buttons and [c][00ff00]Mouseview [-][/c]to rotate and adjust the position of devices when placing.

Use [c][00ff00]PAGE UP/DOWN[-][/c], [c][00ff00]HOME/END[-][/c] and [c][00ff00]INS/DEL[-][/c] buttons and [c][00ff00]Mouseview [-][/c]to rotate and adjust the position of devices when placing.\n\nPlace on any base block OR  use the Build Helper 'Connect to base' ([c][00ff11]N[-][/c]) to place anywhere on the ground.
Armor lockers are required to equip armor suits and for adding or removing Boosters.

Equip any suit by simply dragging it to the [c][00ffff]ARMOR slot[-][/c].   \n\nCheck the 'Game Mechanics Q&A' in the Empyriopedia ([c][00ff11]F1[-][/c]) for more info on suits, boosters and their management!

In case you already found an ARMOR SUIT, equip it by simply dragging it to the [c][00ffff]ARMOR slot[-][/c].  

Otherwise you should craft and equip a LIGHT ARMOR right away, as it not only adds additional hitpoints for upcoming combat, but also adds the functions of a suit light ([c][00ff11]L[-][/c]), jetpack ([c][00ff11]J[-][/c]) and helmet ([c][00ff11]U[-][/c])!

NEXT: craft and place a [c][fbff00]CLONE CHAMBER[-][/c].

[u]Tip:[/u]
Check the 'Game Mechanics Q&A' in the Empyriopedia ([c][00ff11]F1[-][/c]) for more info on suits, boosters and their management!
A food processor allows you to craft advanced meals, medicals and farming equipment.

A food processor allows you to craft advanced meals, medicals and materials required for [c][ffffff]farming.[-][/c]

To proceed, use the capabilities of your [c][ffffff]Small Constructor[-][/c] and [c][ffffff]Food Processor[-][/c] and craft a [c][fbff00]GROWING PLOT[-][/c] (of any material) and a [c][fbff00]PLANT GROW LIGHT[-][/c].

[u]Tip[/u]: 
You can link the Input/Output of any construction machine to each other just by assigning their cargo units and containers accordingly, [c][ffffff]so they can be shared[-][/c]. This way you do not need to manually move the crafting materials!
A growing plot is used to grow any plants.

A plant grow light can be used indoors but also outside, though on temperate planets you can grow your crops without a grow light if the conditions are good.  Check the Empyriopedia ([c][00ff11]F1[-][/c]) for more info about farming!
Place the growing plot to a suitable place on your base.\n\nIn case you have a SPROUT you can place it onto the growing plot right away.

Place the Plant Grow Light at a [c][ffffff]CEILING ABOVE[-][/c] the Growing Plot [c][ffffff]BUT [-][/c]leave the blockspace ATOP the Growing Plot free for placing sprouts!\n\nThe Plant Grow Light has a range of 3x3 large blocks.
You can plant any SPROUT into any growing plot.
In a temperate environment you might not need to use a Plant Grow Light. Check the 'Gameplay Q&A' section of the Empyriopedia ([c][00ff11]F1[-][/c]) for more details!
When having set your bases as HOME (Control Panel > HOME checkbox) a Clone Chamber will allow you to respawn in case of death.\n\nThe same approach works on Capital Vessels.

Open the Control Panel ([c][00ff11]P[-][/c]) and check the [c][ffffff]HOME SPAWN[-][/c] checkbox. 
As long as your base at least has a [c][ffffff]Clone Chamber,[-][/c] you can respawn here.

NEXT: craft and place a [c][fbff00]FOOD PROCESSOR[-][/c].

[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] Commander, I am afraid the failing containment system of the facility has lead to infecting you with a [c][ffffff]Dermal Parasite[-][/c].\n\nI suggest to [c][fbff00]head back to the Talon village[-][/c]. They might have a cure for it!
Go back to the settlement and speak to the chief
[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] Detecting movement around the wreckage!\n\nApproach the site and [c][fbff00]open fire[-][/c] when being attacked!
Approach cautiously. Clear the area from enemies if necessary.
Kill all Zirax troopers and their Ripper dogs.\n\nCheck the area and loot all containers, crates and devices.
[c][00ffff][IDA] [-][/c]Commander, it seems the soldiers have taken a prisoner which is not a Talon.  \n\n[c][fbff00]Speak to him.[-][/c]
Speak to the prisoner in the cage.
[c][00ffff][IDA] [-][/c]Commander, I think you should look for the [c][fbff00]bridge main console[-][/c] before we leave. \n\nWe might not find any remains of the crew, but maybe more info.
Follow the marker on the HUD and find the Sanctuary.

[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] There it is. Make sure you have Doctor Mandors' [c][ffffff]Space Anomalies report[-][/c] with you - although we should not directly ask for Kezzel.\n\n[c][fbff00]Speak to one of the guards[-][/c] in the center building and try to get an appointment with the commander of this station.
Speak to the guard at the elevator to get an appointment with the commander.
Go one level up and then to the right to find Commander Carver
Find Kezzel and speak to him. He is upstairs in one of the storage rooms.
Follow the yellow hud marker to the burial chamber.
Français: Suivez le marqueur hud jaune jusqu'à la chambre funéraire.

English: Find the Technical Artifacts in a container or crate.
Français: Trouvez les artefacts technologiques dans un container.

English: There it is. I sense the spiders already...
Hm. These crates. Someone brought them down here. Obviously they are not historical artifacts...\n\nLet's head back and get some answers from Kezzel.
Français: Hum. Ces containers.. Ce ne sont sûrement pas des artefacts historiques, quelqu'un les a amenés ici de toute évidence. \n\nRetournons voir Kezzel pour obtenir des réponses.

English: Head back to the Sanctuary and speak to Kezzel
[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] Commander, I suggest to remain wary about that agent. Confronting him with your thoughts could be risky. I suggest playing his game for now..

Français: Mise à jour des paramètres de la mission.. veuillez patienter.

English:
[c][00ffff][IDA] [-][/c]There are now two possible directions you can try:

1. Use the secret teleporter behind the cargo containers in the room where agent Kezzel works, find the Small Vessel and escape with it.

2. Head back to your base or camp, install the teleporter and improve your gear at first, as we might run into more and better equipped Zirax troops around their garrison.
Français:
[00ffff][IDA][-] À partir de maintenant, deux choix s'offrent à vous 

1- Utiliser le téléporteur dissimilé derrière des containers dans la pièce où nous sommes. Il vous permettra d'aller récupérer le petit vaisseau. Mais attention, vous serez en territoire Zirax et il vous faudra revenir à la base en évitant les patrouilles de drones. 

2- Retourner directement à la base et vous fabriquer un petit vaisseau. 

Vous devrez peut-être améliorer votre équipement et votre petit vaisseau pour faire face à tout imprévu par la suite. Quand vous serez prêt, partez pour la STATION DE COMMERCE ORBITALE, prenez une biere au BAR SKY GUYS et attendez de voir comment évolue la situation.

English: [c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] There is a damaged Hover Vessel!\n\nIn case you want me to help you on that topic, have a [c][fbff00]have a seat[-][/c] in the cockpit.
Français: [00ffff][IDA][-] Ce doit être le Hover endommagé du prisonnier! \n\nSi vous souhaitez mon aide pour sa réparation, [fbff00]prenez place[-] dans le cockpit et l'assistance se déclenchera.

English: Simple Hover Vessels are usually equipped with GROUND REPULSOR engines, which means they can NOT go over water. For traveling over liquids, you need to upgrade them to HOVER ENGINES T1 or T2
Français: Les vaisseaux Hover sont généralement équipés de moteurs à sustentation COMPACTS, ces modèles NE fonctionnant pas au-dessus de l'eau. Pour pallier à ce problème, vous devez passer à des MOTEUR HOVER v1 ou v2.

English: The Control Panel works the same as for Bases. It will show missing devices in yellow in the DEVICEs tab.
Français: Le panneau de contrôle fonctionne de la même manière que pour les Bases. Il affichera les dispositifs manquants en jaune dans l'onglet PÉRIPHÉRIQUES.

English: Go to the [c][ffffff]DEVICES tab[-][/c] and check the [c][fbff00]YELLOW [-][/c]entries.\n\nThese devices need to be added in order to allow the vessel to function.
Français: Accédez à l'onglet [ffffff]PÉRIPHÉRIQUES[-] et notez les items en [fbff00]JAUNE[-]. \n\nCes appareils doivent être ajoutés au hover pour pouvoir fonctionner.

English: A fuel tank is required for any vessel.
Français: Un réservoir de carburant est indispensable pour tout vaisseau.

English: Same as for bases, the generator provides the energy for all devices.
Français: Comme pour les Bases, le générateur fournit l'énergie pour tous les appareils.

English: Add some Fuel to the tanks and fire up the vessel, pressing ([c][00ff11]Y[-][/c]) or using the POWER slider in the Control Panel.
Hover Vessels use thrusters and hover engines. They can be switched on and off individually either in the main Control Panel page or in the Device tab.

The Hover Vessel is now ready to drive! 

1. Use [c][00ff11]SPACE [-][/c]and [c][00ff11]C [-][/c]to increase and lower the hover height of your vessel!
2. In case you flipped your vessel upside down, use either [c][00ff11]O[-][/c] or [c][00ff11]SHIFT[-][/c] to upright it again!
3. If your vessel handles too twitchy, open the Control Panel ([c][00ff11]P[-][/c]) and adjust the rotation sensitivity in the [c][ffffff]STATISTICS[-][/c] tab.
4. If your vessel has spotlights, use [c][00ff11]L[-][/c] to switch them on and off.

Note that this vessel has an [c][ffffff]open cockpit[-][/c], which does not protect you from enemies or environmental dangers!  

You might want to add a [c][ffffff]detector [-][/c]device to the vessel, as this has much higher range than your handheld variant!
[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] The vessel should be around here somewhere. Use the detector to find it.\n\nYou might need to at least add fuel.
Français: [00ffff][IDA][-] Le vaisseau devrait être quelque part par ici. Utilisez le scanner pour le trouver.\n\nVous devrez peut-être y ajouter du carburant.

English: [c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] There it is!  Make sure no troops are around, fill the tank and fly us out of here back to our base.

Attention! This device requires a lot of energy when being activated! 

Make sure you do not overload your generators, otherwise they will explode!
Check the Control Panel (P) if your output is high enough! 

If not, build more generators or deactivate the teleporter in the meantime.
In case the required power is higher than the output of your generators, the generators will get damaged and explode after a while!

Credibility missions require you to do something for the benefit of a faction that truly proves your value to them.

As a reward, you will receive one or more [c][00ffff]faction credibility seals[-][/c].

Find a [c][00ffff]faction ambassador[-][/c] or connect to a [c][00ffff]Global Information Network[-][/c] (GIN) console at any trading station to redeem the seal.

A seal is used to gradually improve your reputation with the faction from [u]hostile to unfriendly[/u] and from [u]unfriendly to neutral[/u]. 

However, you cannot use faction credibility seals to improve your reputation with the faction beyond neutral.

***
Notes:
- You can also earn the credibility seals through some story missions and quests if they are available for that faction.
- The Zirax Empire Credibility Seal increases your reputation with the Empire and all the Houses of the Empire!

Destroy the [c][fbff00]CORE [-][/c]of  POIs or vessels that belong to the LEGACY. (1)\n\nNote: self-destruct of vessels OR Core-destruction triggered by switches and signal logic do NOT count towards the mission!

Flying a small vessel works the same as driving a hover vessel - except with one additional dimension to go.

Speed up/down: [c][00ff11]W[-][/c], [c][00ff11]S[-][/c]
Align to horizon: [c][00ff11]O[-][/c]
Cruise speed increase/lower: [c][00ff11]CTRL [-][/c]+ [c][00ff11]W [-][/c]/ [c][00ff11]S[-][/c]
3rd Person: [c][00ff11]V [-][/c]([c][ffffff]ALT [-][/c]to undock cam; [c][ffffff]mouseview [-][/c]to move cam)
Afterburner: [c][00ff11]SHIFT [-][/c]+ ([c][ffffff]direction[-][/c])  (Only works with certain thrusters)

Speed up/down: [c][00ff11]W[-][/c], [c][00ff11]S[-][/c]
Align to horizon: [c][00ff11]O[-][/c]
Cruise speed increase/lower: [c][00ff11]CTRL [-][/c]+ [c][00ff11]W [-][/c]/ [c][00ff11]S[-][/c]
3rd Person: [c][00ff11]V [-][/c]([c][ffffff]ALT [-][/c]to undock cam; [c][ffffff]mouseview [-][/c]to move cam)
Afterburner: [c][00ff11]SHIFT [-][/c]+ ([c][ffffff]direction[-][/c])  (Only works with certain thrusters)

[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] You should probably look into the construction of this vessel and add, repair or adjust its components for more speed, agility and defense.  

Check the constructor and Techtree ([c][00ff11]F3[-][/c]) for available devices.
Check [c][ffffff]Control Panel[-][/c] ([c][00ff11]P[-][/c]) > [c][ffffff]STATISTICS [-][/c]for its performance parameters!
So.. let's sit down and wait..

I think we know who this mysterious friend is. 


Let's see where this will go..
Check the Empyriopedia ([c][00ff11]F1[-][/c]) for info about game mechanics and related questions!
[c][ff0000]Mission aborted![-][/c]\n\nOpen the PDA ([c][00ff11]F1[-][/c]) to manually start the [c][ffffff]STORY missions[-][/c] in the [c][ffffff]SOLO MISSIONS[-][/c] tab.

[c][ffffff]Story missions [-][/c]can be found in the PDA ([c][00ff11]F1[-][/c]) [c][ffffff]SOLO MISSION[-][/c] tab!\n\nCheck the Empyriopedia ([c][00ff11]F1[-][/c]) on info about game mechanics and related questions!
Check the Empyriopedia ([c][00ff11]F1[-][/c]) for info about game mechanics and related questions!
Wait for the message to decode.
Wait for the message to be decoded.

Access the [c][ffffff]Portable Constructor [-][/c]and craft a [c][fbff00]Pistol [-][/c]and the [c][fbff00]Pistol Rounds[-][/c].\n\nYou need 5x [c][ffffff]iron[-][/c], 5x [c][ffffff]copper [-][/c]and [c][ffffff]fiber[-][/c].
Eating can be achieved from every inventory ( [c][00ff11]SHIFT + RMB [-][/c]) or by putting the item to the toolbar and using [c][00ff11]LMB[-][/c]
Open the status overview panel [c][00ff00]({keybind(Inventory)}) [-][/c]and eat the Energy Bar by clicking at it with [c][00ff00]SHIFT + Right-Mouse-Button (RMB)[-][/c].

[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] Commander, the signal seems to originate from a [c][ffffff]damaged com station[-][/c] close to our crashsite! I have added a [c][fbff00]yellow marker[-][/c] onto your screen and radar to follow. You should[c][fbff00] go there[-][/c] as you might find more information there.\n\nHold [c][00ff11]SHIFT [-][/c]to run. This will deplete your stamina, though.
Go to the trader you picked up the flamethrower from.
Follow the marker. The bridge is located in the front part of the wreckage.\n\nTip: Jumping in from the side of the bridge area might be an alternative way to find a way inside!
Check the Empyriopedia ([c][00ff11]F1[-][/c]) for info about game mechanics and related questions!
The switch is on the entry of the bridge on a wall between the two stairs leading up in the bridge area.
There is a [c][ffffff]corridor on the left [-][/c]with a [c][ffffff]staircase [-][/c]that should lead to the [c][ffffff]topmost level[-][/c] of the vessel.
[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] We are on the main deck (level 3). \n\nThe bridge is on top of the crew deck (level 7).
Go upstairs to the crew deck (level 7).

[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] The ship is in a full lockdown, but we need to go to the bridge and access the captains logs.\nBehind the blast doors there is a [c][ffffff]corridor on the left [-][/c]with a [c][ffffff]staircase [-][/c]that should lead to the topmost level of the vessel with the [c][ffffff]bridge[-][/c].
Follow the corridor on the left to the bridge
Now I only need to find the [c][fbff00]Bridge Logs[-][/c].\n\nI better check my weapons. This is much too silent for so many lost souls...
The logs are saved on a console in the front part of the bridge.
[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] Access the console and review the logs. \n\nThis should give us a hint about what has happened here.
Access the console and retrieve any available log information.

[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] All the logs should be stored in the main core control. To open the doors, we need to [c][ffffff]deactivate the containment [-][/c]system.\n\nThere is a [c][fbff00]lockdown override switch[-][/c] near the entry of the bridge.
[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] Commander, I am tracking increasing activities in the ship.\n\nBe careful.
The Main Control Deck can be accessed through the staircase on level 5
[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] Attention. Hostile creatures detected moving to our position!
The System Status Console can be found at the other side of the Main Control Deck, close to the windows that allow you to look down into the cargo bay.
[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] The doors are locked due to an ventilation problem.\n\nFind the [c][fbff00]ventilation control [-][/c]and resolve the issues.
The ventilation control is behind the door on the left side of the front cargo bay window.
Pull the lever in the ventilation maintenance room to open the doors on level 4

[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] That did not unlock the direct access to the [c][ffffff]Cargo Bay 2[-][/c], I am afraid. \n\nYou need to go back to the [c][ffffff]staircase [-][/c]and enter the [c][ffffff]maintenance deck[-][/c] on [c][fbff00]level 4[-][/c].
Go back to the staircase. Go down to the maintenance deck (level 4)
[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] Follow the corridors. They are a bit of a labyrinth. Expect bad surprises.\n\nI have set a [c][fbff00]maker on your screen[-][/c] to assist you with the pathfinding.
The maintenance deck corridors are a labyrinth. IDA has marked the exit on your screen.

[c][00ffff][IDA] [-][/c]We need to go further down to the freight deck. To get there, we need to activate the [c][ffffff]Freight Elevator[-][/c]. The switch is in the [c][ffffff]Cargo Bay 2[-][/c], but the way is blocked.\n\nWe need to find the [c][fbff00]System Status Console[-][/c] on the Main Control Deck.
The access doors are on the left side when breaking through the passage the explosion created.
Find the Freight Elevator and go down one level again.
Using the lever might lead to unforeseen activities.
The Warp Control Room is in the engine section. You need to make your way through the freight deck.\nReload often.
[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] There is a [c][fbff00]warp core access [-][/c]door in the control room.
Follow the corridor to the control area for the Turbine Room doors.
[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] We need to go through the warp core and the turbine room, down to the lower freight deck.\n\nFind the [c][fbff00]Turbine Room Lever[-][/c] to unlock the doors.

[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] The lever is damaged. But there is another lever on the other side of the warp core.\n\nUse the door on the other side of the lever, head to the other side of the warp drive and use the [c][fbff00]Alternative Access.[-][/c]
The Alternative Access is on the other side of the warp core. Use your jetpack.
Use the lever to open the turbine room blast door down below.
[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] The blast door on the turbine room has opened. \n\nHead down and enter the turbine control room.
Turbine Control Room is situated in front of the Warp Core on level 1
The Freight Hangar Access door is located on the other side of the Turbine Room entry.
[c][00ffff][IDA] [-][/c]Use the small door on the other side of the room to proceed to the [c][fbff00]Main Cargo Area[-][/c].
The main cargo area is dangerous.

[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] That's inconvenient. The main access of the Core is blocked. We need to purge that container...but the console is in the maintenance area on level 3.\n\nFind the [c][fbff00]Maintenance Access[-][/c] door.
You need to go back to level 3. Check for shortcuts!\nThe Maintenance Access door is located where you entered the vessel the first time
Use the lever in the control room to purge the container in the main cargo area.
The console can be found in the maintenance area. Follow the lines on the ground.
Go back to the main cargo area.
The Cargo Hatch Access lever is on the right side after the main gate.
The Cargo Hatch is a small door on the left wall.
[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] The Cargo Hatch is now open.  Enter the storage rooms behind it.
[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] Find the [c][fbff00]Entry Point[-][/c] to the core area.
The Entry Point can be found easily. Just follow the lights.

[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] My sensors are tracking a constant flow of particles. They seem to come through a damaged vent .. we could also use to get to the core faster.\n\nSearch for a [c][fbff00]Damaged Vent[-][/c] on the upper area of this cargo hold.
The damaged vent is located at the upper part behind a few crates.
[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] There it is. Let's try if we can use this passage. Search for a [c][fbff00]Possible Exit[-][/c].
[c][00ffff][IDA] [-][/c]The particle density is dropping. Be careful!
[c][00ffff][IDA] [-][/c]The next room should hold the [c][fbff00]Core Console[-][/c].  Access it to find answers.

The Ilmarinen is cleaned and secured. Agent Kezzel just sent a message that his organization will take care of the vessel.\n\nMove ahead and [c][fbff00]meet Sectioner32[-][/c] on the [c][ffffff]civil WayStation[-][/c] in one of the [c][ffffff]gas giant moons orbit[-][/c].

[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] Commander. The Ilmarinen is cleaned and secured. Agent Kezzel just sent a message that his organization will take care of the vessel.\n\nWe shall move ahead and [c][fbff00]meet Sectioner32[-][/c] on the [c][ffffff]civil WayStation[-][/c] in one of the [c][ffffff]gas giant moons orbit[-][/c].
[Weakened Whisperer]    \n\n[i][c][9c9c9c].. cannot .. how can a .. lower being ..[-][/c][/i]
[Weakened Whisperer]    \n\n[c][9c9c9c][i].. you will .. be consumed .. and obliterated ..[/i][-][/c]
[Dying Whisperer]    \n\n[c][9c9c9c][i].. this .. not the end .. will prevail .. you .. [/i][-][/c]
[Whisperer]    \n\n[i][c][9c9c9c].. you will pay for harming my children ..[-][/c][/i]
[c][00ffff][IDA] [-][/c]The [c][ffffff]lever[-][/c] for activating the Freight Elevator is in the cargo bay on the [c][ffffff]wall below the windows[-][/c].
[Whisperer]    \n\n[i][c][9c9c9c].. resign from your crusade and your essence will prevail ..[-][/c][/i]
[Whisperer]    \n\n[i][c][9c9c9c].. the powers of this vessel will rebirth me ..[-][/c][/i]
[Whisperer]    \n\n[i][c][9c9c9c].. it is impossible you ever could succeed with what you do ..[-][/c][/i]
[Weakened Whisperer]    \n\n[i][c][9c9c9c].. you seem .. to have .. the will to ..[-][/c][/i]
[Weakened Whisperer]    \n\n[i][c][9c9c9c].. this is not .. possible .. you must be defeated  ..[-][/c][/i]

[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] Commander, I am afraid it is nearly impossible to navigate here. The ship has been rebuilt and the construction plans are worthless.\n\nThe only thing I can try is to [c][fbff00]give you waypoints[-][/c] to guide you in the direction of the core.
[Whisperer]    \n\n[i][c][9c9c9c].. rebelling against the inevitable will achieve nothing ..[-][/c][/i]

[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] Use the freight elevator and go down to the freight deck (level 2).
Expect a lot of those creatures down there. The amount of movement is massive!

Make your way through the freight deck and find the [c][fbff00]Warp Core Control[-][/c] rooms in the engine section.
[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] Use the [c][fbff00]Freight Hangar Access[-][/c] on the other side of the Turbine room.
[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] The area ahead of us seems to be .. rebuilt?\n\nHopefully the Cargo Hatch Access is still there. Go find and use it.
[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] I suggest to [c][fbff00]investigate[-][/c] the [c][ffffff]Control Station. [-][/c]\n\nThe pilot of the vessel has had contact with the station, as the report indicates.
[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] Check any [c][fbff00]console[-][/c] for logs about the reported incident and the Ilmarinen.

[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] Commander, there is a [c][ffffff]deactivated teleporter[-][/c]! The message warned us, but I think we have no choice but to use this teleporter so that we at least have a chance to find out what happened.\n\nCheck the switches in the room to [c][fbff00]reactivate the teleporter.[-][/c]
Find the FUEL TANK display on the [c][00ff00]MAIN [-][/c]tab and hit [c][00ff00]MANAGE [-][/c]to open the FUEL interface.
The Prisoner is held captive in a container at the back of the wreckage
In the overview, use the [c][00ff11]POWER [-][/c]button to activate the base.\n\nAlternatively you can stand on any of the base blocks and hit [c][00ff2a]Y. [-][/c]

After having crashed on this unknown planet, IDA is tracking a faint signal coming from a [c][fbff00]Damaged Com Station.[-][/c]

Find it and start your journey!

[i]Location: Starter Planet; Ellyon System (Starter System)[/i]

[i]---[/i]

[i][c][ffb875]Problem with the mission? [-][/c]Write an email to [c][ff7b00]mission@empyriongame.com[-][/c] or contact us in the forum at [c][ff7b00]empyriononline.com[-][/c]![/i]
Follow the yellow marker on the HUD.
[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] There seems to be a [c][ffffff]console [-][/c]inside the shelter.\n\nFind and access it ([c][00ff11]F[-][/c]).

[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] Commander, I am tracking a faint communication signal in a wreckage nearby.\n\nThere seems to be a [c][fbff00]Damaged Com Station[-][/c] nearby. I have added a [c][fbff00]marker [-][/c]onto your screen.
Help the Colonists to defend against the odds they face. \n\nTrack down and eleminate PIRATES vessels and bases!

Destroy the [c][ffff00]CORE[-][/c] of ORBITAL combat vessels, bases or defense stations. \n\nNote: self-destruct of vessels OR Core-destruction triggered by switches and signal logic do NOT count towards the mission!

The Galactic Information Network consoles offer various important information and administrative services.

The GIN consoles can be found nearby..
- Teleporters
- Main Trading hubs and related areas 
- Main Entrance and Welcome areas

Access the console to use the GIN services to restore your reputation with either faction, visit the shop for buying posters, redeem your Explorer Token and more.

Additional services are planned for future updates!
Warp to any sun of the given class to accomplish the mission.
You made it to space. Congratulations! \n\nRead the Empyriopedia ([c][00ff11]F1[-][/c]) for more info how to navigate in and out of the solar system!

You earned an [c][ffffff]EXPLORER TOKEN![-][/c]\n\nMost of the inhabited solar systems have a sector hosting an official [c][ffffff]TRADING STATION.[-][/c] A good opportunity for all traders and adventurers!

New resource type discovered: [c][ffffff]Iron[-][/c]

You earned an [c][ffffff]EXPLORERS TOKEN[-][/c]. 

Read the Empyriopedia ([c][00ff11]F1[-][/c]) for more info.

You can earn [c][00ffff]Explorer Tokens[-][/c] by discovering ores, planet and moon types and sun classes the first time.

Trade in the Explorer Tokens at a [c][00ffff]Galactic Information Network[-][/c] (GIN) station to increase your rank with the EXPLORERS GUILD & collect EPIC rewards that are only available from there, like the upgrade Kits for getting EPIC Detectors for HV and CV as well as a BA Teleporter with increased range and the Epic Warpdrive for CV

Token can be earned in numbers for:
- discover ores: 17 (triggers on pickup)
- discover planet types + moons: 22 (triggers when landing on the planet/moon)
- discover sun classes: 10 (triggers on warp-in)
- discover home planets: 10 (triggers on entering the sun of the home system)
- Trading Station (1)

Total: 60 token available (max rank = 56)

Please note: there might be special playfields and sun classes that do NOT trigger the Exploration Token reward. Like ContAr13b7 is a Black Hole but also a special area. Same accounts for the actual home planets of factions (whereas discovering the home planet ITSELF gives an Exploration token by entering its orbit. Landing on it does not give an additional Token.) and a few other special places. The Exploration Token are currently given for the more 'default game elements'.
