English:
You can find an INFO HOARDER to sell reports you got from hacked satellites and console on any official trading station (and a few others).

Search for the Trader Cyborg nearby any of the following locations:
- Galactic Information Network (GIN) console
- Teleporters
- Main Trading  hub and related areas
- Main Entrance or Welcome areas

Check 'Missions & Activities: Hacking Consoles (Reports)' for more info!

[u]Summary[/u]
- Some consoles, especially those in satellites, can be hacked to retrieve valuable reports.
- Those reports can be either sold at Info Hoarders or might be required for certain quests or missions.
- Satellites can be found floating around the sun in its warp-arrival area.
- Approach the satellite and access the console to hack it.

[u]How does Hacking work?[/u]
There are three ways to hack a (military, security, explorer, science or communication) report console:
1. With the appropriate clearance key (one-time-use)
2. By manual hacking (% success chance)
3. With a FIRE stick (% success chance / % losing stick on success / % losing stick on failure)

When your hacking was successful, you can always download at least 1 report. You can check for more reports at that point as well without having to hack the console again.

[u]Notes[/u]:
- Each console type has a limit on how many report-download attempts it will accept. Military consoles only allow 2, while Communication consoles allow for 10 downloads. 
- In case you downloaded the maximum amount of reports, the console will be locked and a CLEARANCE KEY is required to unlock it again.
- Failed hacking attempts will immediately lead to the console being LOCKED. A CLEARANCE KEY is required to unlock it again.
- Even when successfully hacking a device, each type of FIRE stick has an individual chance of being destroyed in the process. The chance to destroy the stick is doubled for failed hacking attempts. 
- CLEARANCE Keys are always consumed/destroyed on use.

Where to get those extra keys? (In-development note)
Currently FIRE STICKS ( 'Forced Information Release Executable' remote hacking device) and CLEARANCE KEYS are not yet available. They are planned to be available on certain places or from certain NPCs (missions). 

[c][ffffff]Check empyriononline.com for to follow the development![-][/c]
TITAN Logs - Warp Core Control Room
UCH Heidelberg: Sergeant Palant, Chief of Engineering

After having investigated the Ilmarinen incident, you meet Sectioner32 (virtually) in one of the waystations.  He (or she?) introduces to you the [c][ffffff]G[-][/c]alactic [c][ffffff]L[-][/c]iberation [c][ffffff]a[-][/c]nd [c][ffffff]D[-][/c]efense organization (GLaD) which you have indirectly worked for already (through Agent Kezzel).
This chapter is collecting traces and informations about what has happend to you and your comrades of the UCH.

The waverider protocol is the reason for all the events that took place before the jump to andromeda.  This chapter is collecting any information about the protocol, its purpose and what resulted from it.

This entry in your Journeybook holds the copy of the history database of the UCH. In order to follow database sanity of mobiel devices, only a summary is given in this folder.  \n\nMore information can be requested from the UCH historical office, Road of United Mankind 45A-C, Styringard
This chapter is summarizing all information gathered about the 'Talon-Zirax Assembly'
This chapter is summarizing all information gathered about the 'War of Silence'

This chapter is summarizing basic information about the clans, factions and political parties in Andromeda.\n\nMore detailed information are gathered in the Empyriopedia chapters of each Faction (including vessels, drones, NPC and more)

When you met the former cryo-contained prisoner Kar'han, he revealed to you that the Talon and the Zirax had formed an alliance called the 'Talon-Zirax Asembly'.\n\nWhat he said about the situation at the time he was imprisoned allows the following conclusion: while being at war with another faction, called the 'LEGACY', the Talon-Zirax Assembly fell apart, leading to the Zirax hunting and arresting all Talon personnel for yet unknown reason.
Specialist Kar'han indicated there was a plan to use the 'Infinite Life Program' against the legacy. But it seemed to have failed badly. \n\nNo further information was given on that subject.

The creatures that seem to either be part of the LEGACY or possesed by the LEGACY can be killed by weapon fire or brute force.\n\n They do not suffer from injuries, cold, heat or natural radiation, though.

Doctor Mandor detailed that the anomaly in the Ellyon system appears to be more active than in the past. It is spitting out ships and wreckages once and a while. In the last years this happened in a nearly annual frequency. The reason is unknown.

This is the description of the ACTION. You can find more info on how to complete the described action right here!

Actions can have the following properties:
- [c][ffffff]MANDATORY [-][/c](you need to complete them to complete the active TASK)
- [c][ffffff]OPTIONAL [-][/c]( you may or may not do what is required. It won't block the TASK progress)
- [c][ffffff]ORDERED [-][/c]( Mandatory actions can either be required to be completed in a given ORDER..or random)

You need to complete ALL mandatory ACTIONS (ordered or random) to complete the active TASK.

[u][c][ff7b00]IMPORTANT[-][/c]![/u]
Most of the actions can be solved manually in case something breaks. Just click on the checkbox in front of the broken action in the top-center list of the selected TASK to complete it. [c][ffffff]Consider making a SAVE GAME BEFORE resolving the action (!!) and send it in together with bug report in the game forums over at [-][/c][c][fbff00]empyriononline.com[-][/c][c][ffffff]![-][/c]

The [c][00ff2a]Journeybook [-][/c]tracks your progress through the (side) STORY missions.

It saves summaries about missions, important dialogues as well as facts and figures that you learn about while progressing through the story!

At the start, the Journeybook will be empty. With each mission, task or sometimes when speaking to a particular NPC, new entries will be unlocked!

[c][ff6f00][u][b]IMPORTANT: PDA LOG & SKIP/Additional info choices[/b][/u][-][/c]
When you go through a DIALOGUE with a quest-giver or NPC or Console, the [c][00ff2a]PDA LOG[-][/c] will keep track of that Dialogue (in case you do not SKIP of course!). This way you can re-read it by going to the Mission tab, selecting the headline of the chapter the dialogue was given in and clicking on the [c][00ff2a]PDA LOG[-][/c] button. This will reveal all messages and dialogue content related to this chapter/mission!

[c][ffffff]In case you used a 'SKIP' answer intentionally or accidentally in a dialogue instead of a selecting 'Additional Info' you do NOT lose that unread/skipped information![-][/c]

[c][ffffff]To make sure the relevant info is available at all times, the PDA will add the most essential information about a specific topic to your Journeybook![-][/c]

These topics are sorted by themes, like 'main story' or side stories or mission summaries or characters and more!

[c][ffff00]Click on the header of this chapter (10 Tips for GETTING STARTED) in the list on the LEFT to reveal the content of this chapter[-][/c] [c][ffff00]IF nothing is shown, make sure the button PDA INFO is highlighted in the TOP RIGHT![-][/c]

Unlike the JOURNEYBOOK (which tracks your progress in regards to STORY content), the [c][00ff2a]EMPYRIOPEDIA [-][/c]tracks your progress in regards to exploration and activities!

[u]CONTENT[/u]
The Empyriopedia offers several groups and chapters centered around tips and tricks about features and gameplay:
- STARTER INFO: 10 Tips for GETTING STARTED
- GAME MECHANICS Q&A (short summaries of game mechanics and features)
- GAME MECHANICS group (explains certain game mechanics in detail!)
- Missions & Activities (explains certain mission types and ingame activities)

The Empyriopedia also holds a wide range of encyclopedic entries for NPC, fauna, flora, factions, stars, planets and more! They often have more info and details about certain ingame assets!

[u]FUNCTIONS[/u]
- The game help & info chapters are always visible. 
- The encyclopedic entries will be made visible while you explore the galaxy or unless you do certain things.

Example: Some will be unlocked by just discovering their content (f.ex. planets, star classes etc). Others might be made visible, when you do certain things or play through certain missions.

You can even earn rewards for doing so. Check 'Missions and Activities' for more info!

[i]Note: the Empyriopedia currently does not hold ALL game assets (stations, vessels, etc) but will grow over time while new elements are added![/i]

GROUP MISSIONS (also called 'Faction Missions') are specifically designed for being played in multiplayer!

You can play them alone or with your team, as long as everyone is in your player faction!

One player of the faction can start a mission from this tab and other players of your group/clan/faction can join.

Note: If the mission is not completed, all progress is LOST!
The Talon Chief confirms that there were other survivors, but they arrived one year ahead of you.

The Bartender of the Eleon Inferno Club told you a story about other survivors of the UCH having had a fight with Zirax troopers in this club.

More important, one of the terrans was called Alex!

So not only there are remains of the UCH fleet hiding somewhere, but also your partner, Alex, seems to be alive!

The Talon Chief in the village indicates that the Talon are not natives, but have chosen to reduce the every day high tech to its bare minimum.\n\nThey are still capable of handling any technology. They prove ths  by adding a new communication scrambler protocol to your suit com module.  This way your allies can reach out to you more easily.
Garrison at the End of the World

The Zirax have a garrison still stationed in the Ellyon system.  The reason is the active anomaly zone that spits out ships and wreckages frequently. 

Although this sounds like it would be an important task, the monitoring of the systems activities does not seem to be top priority for the Zirax Empire.

Even the duty in this garrison seems to be kind of a penalty for the soldiers stationed here: The stations are badly armored, the troopers are badly equipped. They even try to pinch equipment and supplies from the Talon and Polaris in the system.  Sometimes just by pure boredom as it seems.

The Polaris Megacorp is present in most of these unclaimed border systems, running workshops and trading stations.\n\nThe Polaris and Zirax are not friends, but also not enemies. Neither of them will help each other in case of an emergency .. at least as long as there are no benefits for those helping.

The inscription plates found in the Ancient Temple say:\n\n[i]The Legacy once ruled all the worlds of this galaxy.  Worlds fell apart and into silence, but the honorable Zirax, with the Infinite Life Program, were able to end the threat once and for all, and it might never return.  Praise the High Command![/i]

The Ilmarinen is a long-range exploration and mining vessel of the Kullervo Class.  It was sent to deep space by the Polaris Megacorps and did not return. Agent Kezzel has approached you to investigate.

According to Agent Kezzel, the Legacy invaded the galaxy in a distant past.  It was just about defeated after a war that had most of the inhabited worlds falling into the besaid silence.  The Legacy does not want to concquer territory like the Zirax or Kriel. It just obliterates any live.

While talking to the ghostly entity, it reveals that it wants to 'ascend' all the 'lower biological beings' to the 'higher spheres'. No additional info is given by that entity, but you can assume that it is most likely a splinter of the LEGACY that took over the Ilmarinen after Polaris brought the artifact on board.
After the events on the Ilmarinen, it comes clear that the LEGACY is kind of a mental entity, which can directly speak to a biological beings mind.

The entity seems to have the powers to capture biological beings, transforming them into .. something else. How this works is not clear, although you have seen these creatures before and in different places already.

Mahan Station was one of the archives of the Zirax-Talon Assembly!  It was built to survive the war of silence, and the destruction of its home world, preserving the history and technology of the glorious past, for you or anyone else to make good use of it.\n\nThe information found indicates that there might be more of these stations to be found in the galaxy. Some may have survived as well!
Talon History - A Symbol Of The Past
Talon History - A Symbol Of Dispute
Talon History - A Symbol Of Dispute

While examining the UCH Heidelberg wreckage, you find indications that you did not arrive WITH the fleet, but lost 1 year for some unknown warp-drive-jump-gone-wrong reasons while you were dragged into the warp-vortex of the TITAN and the Operation Phoenix fleet.\n\n[c][ffffff]You are actually in the year 2474.[-][/c]

You finally meet GLaD as an organization. The organization staff recruits from survivors of the Operation Phoenix Fleet.  Some of you are already known to you from the UCH Heidelberg lots, like Commander Mercer Junior, Emmerson and Palant.
You also learn that your partner Alex is alive and that she is 'Sectioner32' and that she is leading GLaD and all its operations.

Commander Mercer Junior, the son of Cmd. Mercer who lead the voyage on board of the TITAN, is commanding the GLaD outpost.\n\nHe actually confirmed what you already found out - about the attack of the Zirax when the fleet arrived in Andromeda, their retreat to a secret position and the loss of the TITAN and other vessels.

The logs of the com station reveal that other UCH survivors might be somewhere on this planet or nearby:

'August, 2, 2473.  UCH PID 19893-M 
The .. is lost. We .. survived and made contact with the Talon in the nearby village.  The Zirax are on our heels. We need to avoid running into their drones and .. until they lose interest.  A temporary camp near .. I am afraid some of our .. vessels were shot down .. crashed .. not far away. We plan to .. If this plan fails, I advise every other survivor to go find one of the Talon villages. These guys helped us to survive, and might help you as well. - End of Message.'
The console shows some discrepancies between the log dates and your suit. The timestamps of the logs are 1 year old. This could be a result of the console being damaged badly.

What we also know is, that The Legacy was defeated, but not destroyed when the War of Silence ended. And it seems as thought that entity is coming back to live more and more. As you, and others, already found out first hand.

Ten years ago a Zirax science team found a technical artefact in a remote excavation site at the edge of their territory. The Salurian clan seems to have stolen the artifact and sold it to Polaris right away. That's at least what the company manager typed in the log. The company brought the artifact to this station for being examined in the exotic materials lab. We have put it in an extremely strong containment field, but that was not enough I think. I alarmed the company, but they did not want to listen. As always. 

 Long story short, the artifact started to aggressively capture my AI core and turned the station's internal defenses against the crew. I could not do anything. The company lost two destroyers in the evacuation. 

A brave scientist named Yarod Halden downloaded my routines to a cyborg for being evacuated, but he did not survive and I was left behind. The station core was bombarded with EMP. I survived because he had shut me down before the attack started. 

As far as I can say I was reactivated five years after this incident by a caretaker looking for a helper cyborg. The station was reactivated and officially run by some civil management, while the real power was held by the Salurian using this station for their criminal endeavors. 

A few months ago, the engineering cyborgs of the station suddenly started to build new machines. I noticed some of the Salurian were concerned. Talking about an artifact found in the caverns which allowed them to create a new drug that had interesting effects on the consumers. Strength, speed, spatial awareness increased .. and a sudden death in case of the dose only being slightly too high. 

I started to investigate what happened. As it seems the artifact is - or was - a fragment of a larger entity found ten years ago by the Zirax archaeologists. They call it 'Essence of the VOID'. I found out that the Salurian did not intend to create that drug - Trilinithane - the station itself started to produce it, after the Salurian experimented with the fragment. So the past events are about to repeat themselves. But this time, we have a chance to stop it before it kills all civilians on board.

Trilinithane is a fluid of unknown properties. I have found several specimens of that material when I investigated what the pirates are doing here. This material does not exist in any world of this part of the galaxy. Neither the Zirax, nor the Kriel or any other faction uses this. The production plans indicate it is kind of a very advanced type of nanofluid enriched with nanobots. I doubt any of the known civilizations would be able to produce it .. although ...

The knowledge about the LEGACYs structure  (see: What IS the LEGACY chapter) was used by the Ghyst and the Xenu for the Infinite Life Forms (ILF) weapon (created by the Serdu), - after the destruction of several planets with conventional weapons did not succeed.\n\nThe ILF was deployed on many worlds, creating a myriad of unintelligent, lower lifeforms. The theory was that the LEGACY could be 'dried out' or at least distracted, while spending more and more effort to compensate for the loss of its Legacy Particles, while conventional weapons destroy their hives. This strategy seems to have been successful as the Legacy was pushed back to the edge of the galaxy.
The War of Silence started 1300 years ago and officially ended 900 years ago.

[[c][00ffff]unknown[-][/c]] .. have no other choice if we want to get this New Eden project going.  
[[c][00ffff]unknown[-][/c]] And I am sure you do not want to face the consequences, correct?  
[[c][00ffff]Mercer[-][/c]] Of course not, sir, but what about Lamarr, Zerogen and the others? 
[[c][00ffff]unknown[-][/c]] Commander! What did I just say? Did you listen to my words? 
[[c][00ffff]Mercer[-][/c]] Sure, but in case Commander {PlayerName} find out what we did, we..
[[c][00ffff]unknown[-][/c]] That won't be your problem anymore in a few hours.
[[c][00ffff]unknown[-][/c]] Did you make sure the cargo is untouched? 
[[c][00ffff]Mercer[-][/c]] Yes, they are secured in our lower dock. 
[[c][00ffff]unknown[-][/c]] Good. 
[[c][00ffff]unknown[-][/c]] Make sure that no one is putting his dirty hands on them. 
[[c][00ffff]unknown[-][/c]] Do not stand in the way of my employees and you will be fine. 
[[c][00ffff]Mercer[-][/c]] Affirmative, sir.
Doctor Mandor was on a science mission, analyzing data from the anomaly in the Ellyon system.  He is working for the Polaris.
A talon warrior searching for precious technical artifacts around A01 Gamma.\n\n[i]Note: Please play the Game Tutorial to learn more about the incidents at A01 Gamma.[/i]

The home system of the Polaris Megacorp is the center of its industrial and logistics operations. Any ore freighter of the company and any vessels with valuable goods produced on the companies behalf in and outside of its territory will transport their precious load to this system eventually.

Residing on a lush alien world, the Polaris Company HQ and lots of its main logistic facilities have been built on that planet a long time ago. Any business runs from exactly this place. Every order to manage its incredible production capabilities of the company, down to any mine of the very edge of the territory originates from here.
The main industry facilities are build on the moon of the Polaris Megacorp home system - mostly due to highly unstable and toxic substances processed.

Although the Traders Guild administration council cannot be compared to a company like Polaris Megacorp or the empire of the Zirax, its members have agreed to the necessity of having a central hub for speaking to each other, for congregations and some mutual planning of their wide spread activities. The guild central is situated in this solar system. You are friendly welcome .. in case you have something to trade.

The Guild Central of the Traders Guild can be best compared to an open trading market, which is open to anyone interested in great offers and perfect trades.\n\nThe guild councils meeting places are only known by those that are part of the organization. Strangers are not welcome there.

Congratulations! 

You discovered the alledged position of the hidden [c][ffffff]Pirates Lair[-][/c] and earned an [c][ffffff]EXPLORER TOKEN[-][/c]. 
[c][ffffff][-][/c]
Read the Empyriopedia ([c][00ff11]F1[-][/c]) for more info.

An Neutron Star, spreading death rays in all directions is not only hiding the 'Pirates Council'  but also several of the main bases of the leaders of the various pirate brotherhoods, called the 'Pirates Lair'.

The Pirates Lair is not comparable to any administrative location of other factions. It is merely a place where all the pirate chiefs try to earn the respect of the others and have a say in the annual meetings of the 'Pirates Council'.

Do not expect to be welcomed.
This is kind of the home system of the TESCH .. or what comes closest to its meaning for a race of AI machines.

The 'home planet' of the TESCH might actually not be their birthplace. Ruins of an ancient civilization and strange black pillars cover the planetary surface. Peaking through its thick ice and snowy crust, they are telling stories of times long forgotten. The TESCH do not reside on that planet, but they consider it their 'sanctuary'.

The Brotherhoods mission statement is to bring peace to the galaxy through prosperity as Farr did on Parthix. Using their great wealth they will provide food, shelter and medical treatment to those that need it throughout the stars.

Every member is a Brother, Women included. There are 4 ranks within the Brotherhood with several layers of seniority within those.
- Initiate, a recruit of the brotherhood, learning the ways but not ready to teach.
- Brother, the main rank of the Brotherhood, promoting equality and teaching the lessons of Farr
- Elder, when conflicts arise, Elder Brothers are called upon to resolve and provide wisdom to the younger.
- Eldest, only one can be the eldest, he or she is a spiritual leader and will interpret the teachings of Farr, they will also maintain that which Farr left us.
The ARC company is producting any kind of high tech utilities.
The Wastelanders are a group of scavengers.
The Home System of the Brotherhood of Farr.

[c][00ffff][b]Chapter 11: Murky Christmas[/b][-][/c]

A strange signal is interfering with the radio systems. It seems to come from the solar orbit of the system you arrived in at the beginning of your adventure.

Fly back to the [c][fbff00]ELLYON system[-][/c] to get to the bottom of it!

[i]Note: This mission activates automatically when you enter the solar orbit of the ELLYON system![/i]

[i]---[/i]

[i][c][ff7b00]Problem with the mission?[-][/c] Write an email to [c][ffb875]mission@empyriongame.com[-][/c] or contact us in the forum at [c][ffb875]empyriononline.com[-][/c]![/i]
Commander, we are picking up a strange signal from the [c][fbff00]ELLYON system[-][/c]. \n\nWe should head there immediately!
Get in the sledge and fly to the [c][fbff00]moon of the gas giant[-][/c].
Ho Dasher, Dancer, Prancer, Vixen, Comet, Cupid, Donner, Blitzen, Rudolph!
Approach the village IDA [c][fbff00]marked [-][/c]for you on the HUD.
It looks like a Talon village.\n\nI think we should [c][fbff00]talk to the traders[-][/c] and question them as inconspicuously as possible
Find the trader and talk to him.
The shaman is inside the ruins of the Temple of Farr
The Shaman will open the doors to the caves if you give him a present.
Hello? Help! Is anyone there? \n\nPlease [c][fbff00]open the door[-][/c]!
Thank you so much stranger! You saved me! \nHow can I ever thank you for that!
Thank the trade saints, you saved me! \nHow can I ever repay you?
Ho! Ho! Ho! \n\nGet me out of here already. Quick, before they come back!
Ah well finally someone with brains and guts to get us out of here!
Follow the markers to the prison cells.
[Whisperer] \n\n[c][9c9c9c][i]Hm... I'll have to take a closer look.[/i][-][/c]
That's it. All saved. \n\nNow let's get out of here.

[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] I have just been informed that all the prisoners have escaped safely. We must leave the moon's jamming field, [c][fbff00]go into orbit[-][/c] and report to GLaD so that a transporter can be sent to pick up the other abductees
Fly back to orbit and report to GLaD
There's supposed to be... a station made of candy canes and wrapping paper.
[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] Commander. The signal is coming from this station. \n\nBe careful when [c][fbff00]going in[-][/c]!
From out of the forest of stars I come...

[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] Sensors are detecting a convergence of signals in an area that is spatially indeterminate. \n\nI recommend [c][fbff00]scanning the orbit for structures[-][/c] or  anomalies and [c][fbff00]approaching them[-][/c] cautiously for closer examination.
Fly to the orbit of the planet.
[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] Commander, the detected [c][ffffff]structure[-][/c] is directly ahead. You'll be surprised at what it looks like...
Scan the area and find possible traces. \nFly there to examine them.

[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] The [c][fbff00]console[-][/c] in front of us appears to contain a holographic AI as its user interface. Since nothing unusual has happened so far, they should [c][fbff00]talk to it[-][/c].\n\nThe universal translator is activated for safety.
[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c]  We are receiving a position signal emanating from the [c][fbff00]surface of the moon[-][/c]. \n\nSo the abductees must still be there!
Analyze the situation and find [c][ffffff]ContAr1a95 [-][/c]on the galaxy map.\n\nUse the 'Search System' button and type in the term into the TYPE field.

[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] No Commander, and I must also inform you that an interference field on this moon is cutting off all communication to the outside world.  \n\nWe should [c][fbff00]speak to the village chief[-][/c] to get clarification.
IDA, does this make any sense to you?
Find the Talon Chief. He might be near the defense installations
The chief might know more about what is going on in this village.

Congratulations! You have found one of the test planets of the [c][ffffff]new decoration system[-][/c]! 

Take a good look around and write us your [c][ffffff]feedback[-][/c] in the pinned post in the Experimental Forum at [c][ff7b00]empyriononline.com[-][/c]!  

[i]Note: It is intentional that there are no animals or POI on this planet![/i]
[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] The signal is coming from a small settlement.  \n\nI've [c][fbff00]marked the position[-][/c] for you.
[Whisperer]\n\n[c][9c9c9c][i]Now we'll see what's special about this one...[/i][-][/c]

[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] Commander, the station reports problems with the fuel depot containment fields. \n\nWe should [c][ff7b00]shut down weapons and turrets[-][/c] in the control panel ([c][00ff11]P[-][/c]) before landing!
The pirate base is marked on your hud. It is in the same orbit than the trading station and the distillery

[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] This appears to be the pirate base, Commander.  \n\nSomeone inside should know where we can find the recipe .. or might want to hand it over with the use of appropriate arguments.
Fly to the orbital trading station
Here we go. What did Kezzel say? \n\nGo to the [c][ffffff]Sky Guys[-][/c] bar, get a [c][ffffff]beer [-][/c]and [c][ffffff]sit down[-][/c]?
[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] Commander, I found some indices of nearby tribal villages.\n\nI added a [c][fbff00]marker [-][/c]for the approximate direction to your HUD and Radar.
[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] Commander, I am detecting a large wreckage ahead of us. Size and composition indicate an UCH Pelican type transport.\n\nProceed with caution!

The TITAN wreckage is located on the SNOW planet in the starter system. \nYou need a WARP-capable vessel (Small Vessel + Warpdrive + Pentaxid Tank + Pentaxid fuel).\nYour vessel should have weapons and turrets.
Land on the planet and find the TITAN
[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] Reduce speed! Several energy signatures detected. Active signatures.\n\nA minefield!
This seems to be the station where we were said to meet Sectioner32.
Go back to your vessel and wait for new messages.

[c][00ffff][b]Chapter 7: Meet the GLaD[/b][-][/c]

Looking back at your time in Andromeda, you feel like you've been stumbling from one event to another, making friends and foes as you go but without being aware of the bigger picture. Your gut feel is that there must be something that explains all this. Even after showing your new allies the information about the Talon, Zirax and Legacy having a shared history, things are not getting any better.

You are still in doubt as to the motives of the Galactic Liberation and Defense organisation. Your partner, Alex, might be part of this group and you understand they support a Talon rebellion against the Zirax Empire. However, most of this does not make any sense to you yet.

But things are about to change...

Find the [c][ffff00]SigmaZero[-][/c] system, situated in the area between Zirax, Traders Guild and Polaris territories. 
(You can also use the TYPE field of the 'search system' function on the galaxy map!)

Fly to the [c][ffff00]asteroid field [-][/c]in that sector and meet the GLaD!
[i][c][ffffff][-][/c][/i]
[i]---[/i]

[i][c][ff7b00]Problem with the mission?[-][/c] Write an email to [c][ffb875]mission@empyriongame.com[-][/c] or contact us in the forum at [c][ffb875]empyriononline.com[-][/c]![/i]
Fly to the asteroid field in the Sigma Zero sector!
Wait until the message is downloaded.
[c][00ffff][IDA][-][/c] I am receiving a weak UCH positioning signal. \n\nI'll add a [c][fbff00]marker [-][/c]to your radar and hud.

Author: Vera Lebedev

Vera Lebedev graduated with a Master’s Degree in Biological Research from University Nebo Kozlov in 2467 and has gone on to be one of the most prolific deep space biology experts in Andromeda. She has published all fifteen of her books from her home station, Norilsk. Her works are an extensive compilation of her own discoveries, numerous explorer reports and other scientific theorems.

Source: Vera Lebedev, Personal Biological Findings, published 2471

[c][ffffff]This chapter of the Empyriopedia contains information on all biological topics such as plants, half plants, anything that can be grown or harvested (plants or crystals), creatures that do not belong to one of the NPC factions, and related topics.[-][/c]

Note: Information on equipment needed for farming or growing crops can be found in the [c][ffffff]Crafters Manual[-][/c] section!  

[i]Expand and reveal the info of the chapter categories and their sub-folders by [c][80ffff]clicking on their headline[-][/c] and/or by clicking the [c][80ffff]arrow-buttons [-][/c]next to them.[/i]

This chapter of the Empyriopedia contains information on the use and production of items, devices and equipment, as well as on the available resources and related topics.\n\n[i]Expand and reveal the info of the chapter categories and their sub-folders by [c][80ffff]clicking on their headline[-][/c] and/or by clicking the [c][80ffff]arrow-buttons [-][/c]next to them.[/i]
Available in nearly any location, either intentionally or as a byproduct from drilling and mining.

New resource type discovered: [c][ffffff]Crushed Stones[-][/c]

You earned an [c][ffffff]EXPLORERS TOKEN[-][/c]. 

Read the Empyriopedia ([c][00ff11]F1[-][/c]) for more info.
Can be produced with a portable O2 generator (small bottles) or produced in a constructor (large bottles)
Can be produced with a water generator or melted from ice.

This area of the Empyriopedia contains information medical, fauna, flora and other topics!\n\n[i]Expand and reveal the info of the chapter categories and their sub-folders by [c][80ffff]clicking on their headline[-][/c] and/or by clicking the [c][80ffff]arrow-buttons [-][/c]next to them.[/i]

Can be mitigated by: -
Can be cured by: Detox Kit, Decontamination Kit, Anti Parasite Injection, Medical Station Type 4

Increases: health rebuild, movement speed, stamina rebuild, food consumption rate
Reduces: Body radiation 

Caused by: Combat Injuries
Will also start: Fever Attack

Ailment Specifics: 
At this point, the parasite has moved through its first two life cycles: the dermal and endo stages. An agonizing full blown infestation begins. The creature quickly tunnels through muscle tissue, vital organs, and the central nervous system. Unsurprisingly, this causes extensive tissue damage and exhaustion. The body has no natural defenses. Few patients are ever examined as most are beyond help or dead before they reach a clinic.

The organism converts the flesh of the host into something much more adapted to its needs. Roughly half the patients die at this stage. They are the lucky ones. The other half become terrible malformed abominations that seek to spread their offspring to the universe.

Other Notes: This is one of the most horrific diseases that any person could ever encounter. Reports from my colleagues state that these parasites are responsible for many facility abandonments in numerous galaxies. Andromeda has been cited as a hotspot. A ridiculous amount of caution is advised if you suspect carriers are in the area.

Entry Author: Patty Carter
Date: April 15th 2472

Treatments: rest/sleep, milk, hot beverages, antitoxic pills or injection, first aid kit, detox kit, fire moss scrapings, sleep (bed, tent), toilet

Evolves into: Untreated cases will become hangovers.
Also creates: n/a

Reduces: stamina rebuild, movement speed
Increases: food consumption

Caused by: NaturalStimulant, Radiation Immunity Shot, Energy Pills, MushroomBrown

Eating foreign uncooked food or drink, over ingesting natural stimulants and energy pills. Lastly, drinking too much berry wine, as this doctor personally learned.

Ailment Specifics: 
Psychedelic Alteration, more commonly known as a “Bad Trip”, is no state that any knowledgeable space traveler wants to find themselves in. In most cases, a feeling of queasiness accompanies visual distortions. Patients have also commonly reported fatigue. These symptoms are deadly enough in a hostile environment, but there are some other rare symptoms. These include audio or visual hallucinations and feelings of paranoia. Most notably the sensation of being watched or sharing your mind with some unknown entity.

Other Notes: 
Some patients report euphoria with their “trips”. After this, they actively sought them out. They did not survive prolonged repeated exposures nor did they return from their expeditions.

Entry Author: Patty Carter
Date: January 19th 2470

Most alien teeth are affixed to their owners and require some force to remove. They are namely used for defense, if the creature is prey, or attack if it is a predator. They should be handled with care as residual fluids on it can lead to envenomation in some species.

While they come in a variety of wondrous shapes and sizes, nearly all can be synthesized for detoxification medicines. The resulting drug can assist not only with poisons or contaminants from the host creature, but with other sources of toxic build up as well.

The biggest trouble is getting their owners to relinquish them. However, I don’t blame them for being reluctant to part with their dental anatomy.

Source: Vera Lebedev, Astrological Biology, published 2472

The humble Alien Thorn is one of the most useful plant products in the galaxy. It can be found on a number of prickly vegetation throughout explored and unexplored space. It does come in a variety of lovely colors, but the most common, and identifiable, is the green base with the orange or red spike.

It can be created using the food processor as well. However, it is much more energy and time efficient to simply harvest them when encountered.

Few appreciate these Sclerenchyma structures until they find themselves injured. Their cellular make up causes them to be a vital component in Health Packs and First Aid Kits. Their chemical compounds help assist with rapid tissue regeneration. Don’t say that plants never did anything for you after getting medical attention.

Source: Vera Lebedev, Astrological Biology, published 2472

Another beneficial substance from florae is Alien Plasma T6. It is a sticky sap and is gray in color. This substance is the lifeblood of the plant itself and is antiseptic in nature. Several species are already known to secrete it. Those include, but are not limited to: some pod plants, certain coral species, and cacti species.

Harvesting is simple enough, just scrape the dermal layer of the subject and collect the ooze which comes out. It will have a slightly sweet smell if you’ve selected it correctly.

The sap is a vital part of health pack and decontamination kit creation. If you ever run low, the material can be manufactured at a food processor. You’ll need a protein base, some cellulose, and Alien Plasma ZR1. When in a patch of foliage that produces Alien Plasma T6, I suggest you take as much as you can. You don’t know when you’ll bump into it again and it doesn’t harm the plant any.

Source: Vera Lebedev, Interstellar Biological Discoveries, published 2470

In most cases Alien Plasma ZR1 can be collected from water based plants. They are namely coral or reefs. While it can be found from other plant varieties, it can also be created with natural compounds at a processor.

In its natural form it is a light and flakey algae ridge which blooms on the vegetation’s stalk. It comes in a rainbow of flashy colors, but its most common form is that of a pinkish-red.

Medically, it has antiseptic properties and is used for health pack manufacturing or detoxification curatives.

I must admit that I have preserved several specimens and kept them on display. They are a great decoration and conversation starter. 

Source: Vera Lebedev, The Botanical Colors of Andromeda, published 2471

Alien parts are exactly what they sound to be, parts from alien creatures. I could write volumes on these different parts from different species. Maybe I will one day.

What we do know is that utilizing the amino acids and calcium from these structures is of great medical benefit. Of course, most animals are not willing to simply remove their appendages on your behalf. So it is advised to harvest the parts whenever you must slay a creature. Otherwise, they can be replicated at a workstation.

The calcium and amino acids are processed to transfer the resistances of the former creature. As such they are very effective at fending off parasites that other native species have adapted to. They are a vital component to the creation of Alien Plasma ZR1 and thus have many more flexible applications. 

Source: Vera Lebedev, Andromeda’s Biology, published 2470

One of my favorite topics are the many varieties of berries in Andromeda. They are all relatives of each other and that is proof of their hardiness across the systems. Individual flowers form clusters on the plant which blooms throughout seasons and any climate. No wonder they spread so well!

Once fruited, their flower clusters form berry clusters, much like grapes from the Sol System and just as edible. They can range from green, white, black, red, yellow, and the most common deep blue color. The flesh is soft and each berry has a pit which reproduces when allowed to propagate.

These berries make great juices, cake fillings, and even some delicious wines. Each planet, or ecology on that planet, will have a different flavor. It makes them a wonderful treasure wherever they are found.

Source: Vera Lebedev, Eating Andromeda, published 2468

The easily overlooked buds are a resource that you’ll want in your kitchen. Several different species of plant produce buds. One is a large leafy green shrub. The other is a big blue flower with massive stamens and pistils. As hermaphroditic plants, they reproduce quickly and are found throughout the systems.

To harvest the buds, simply scrape off the green nodules on the ends of their new growth. Some will feel smooth and others are very coarse.

These rough outgrowths are adapted to resist the elements trying to stifle them. Their internal chemistry generates self-sustaining heat. Mix them into a Too Hot beverage and you’ll find them warming your body in any climate. A Too Hot beverage is also a great addition to any emergency ration.

Source: Vera Lebedev, Eating Andromeda, published 2468

Medical as well as normal, edible or consumable items can cause various intended or unintended (side) effects in addition to the primary effect!

To differentiate in the entries:

[c][ffffff]Fully heals[-][/c]
If you consume this item, the mentioned status effect or disease will ALWAYS be healed immediately.

Example: If you use First Aid Kit at Open Fracture this injury disappears. 

Note, however, that when a status effect is HEALED, side effects can also occur! See the respective status effect entry under 'Afflictions'.

[c][ffffff]Mitigates (Protects)[-][/c]
If you consume an item that has a 'Mitigates' effect, it will help you with an illness, but without curing it.

If [c][ffffff]PROTECTS [-][/c]is also set to TRUE, this means that you are protected from the subsequent illness of the respective status effect after using this item!

Example: If you take Antibiotic Pills while you have an Infected Wound, this does not cure the Infected Wound, but allows the wound to 'heal' faster and reduces e.g. the loss of health in the meantime. In addition, taking it also protects you from the secondary disease: when the timer for Infected Wound has expired, there is NO 'sepsis' as would otherwise have been the case!

You can see whether such a 'Mitigate' effect is currently in effect at the bottom left of the screen: The border around the respective status effect turns [c][00ff11]GREEN[-][/c].

[c][ffffff]When consumed, always triggers
When consumed, has risk of starting[-][/c]

Some items can have positive or negative side or additional effects.

Example: An Adrenaline Shot always creates a Stamina Boost that gives you your stamina back faster. However, if you take too many Energy Pills, there is a certain probability that you will slip into a Bad Trip!

Author: Patty Carter
Date: March 15th 2470
Topic: Introductions

Hello, I am Doctor Patty Carter. These medical notes and journals are entries that I have created for you, the reader. I graduated from Messier University, on the Free Colonist Perseus Station, in 2456 with a doctorate in clinical medicine. From there I joined up as a frontier doctor and that’s where I intend to remain. In that time I’ve seen just about every injury, sickness, and mishap that can occur to the human body. These journals will always be free and published to all human sectors in Andromeda. I hope they save many lives and you never have an emergency to which you must refer to them.

We distinguish between:
- [c][fbff00]Afflictions [-][/c]= diseases, illnesses with mostly negative effects. But some also have interesting positive side effects.
- [c][fbff00]Benefits [-][/c]= things that protect or help you.

The entries explained:

[c][ffffff]Treatments[-][/c]
Items (medical or food!) and devices that heal an affliction completely at once. 

Important: Entries for the above items and devices as well as their use and side effects can be found under 'Medical Items & Devices'!

[c][ffffff]When not cured / When expired[-][/c]
When the timer of an affliction expires, the previous affliction turns into the (usually worse) subsequent affliction.

[c][ffffff]When cured[-][/c]
Some status effects create a subsequent status effect when they are cured. 

Example: You get another status effect Closed Fracture plus Open Wound following the healing of Open Fracture! So sometimes you have to take more precautions. The respective entry of the status effect explains which follow-up effects can occur!

[c][ffffff]Also creates[-][/c]
If the affliction started, it creates the mentioned affliction(s) additionally!

[c][ffffff]Effects[-][/c]
The effect of the affliction on your avatar while the timer is running: Health, Maximum Health, Food, Stamina, Radiation, Temperature etc. 

[c][ffffff]Caused by[-][/c]
The causes that can lead to the mentioned affliction either directly or with a certain chance. 

[c][ffffff]Ailment Specifics[-][/c]
Affliction notes written by me and other medical professionals from Andromeda and the Milky Way.

There are six types of afflictions:

- [c][ff0000]Wound[-][/c]: On the whole, easy to manage. Health-damaging effects that can develop into worse things if not treated.
- [c][ae00ff]Disease[-][/c]: Dangerous conditions that cause the death of the subject.
- [c][fbff00]Infection[-][/c]: Self-sustaining afflictions that wear down the player.
- [c][00ffff]Toxin[-][/c]: Short-lived, mild effects that develop into malignant diseases.
- [c][ffffff]Temperature[-][/c]: The usual heat and cold effects. As the body temperature becomes more extreme, these effects also increase.
- [c][ffffff]Radiation[-][/c]: The usual radiation effects. When radiation increases, these effects occur.

The four main types are divided into these categories:

{AfflictionsOverview.jpg}

Which afflictions produce which effects and how they can be cured or mitigated is listed in the entries for Afflictions, Benefits, Medical Items & Medical Devices!

Français: Trouvez les journaux de bord des planètes de classe mortelle de type 1.

English:
Find out what happened on Dead class planets by collecting logs from each of the 6 types of Dead class planets.
You will need to visit each type of Dead planet and starter planets do not count.
Dead class planets are more common in D and K class star systems.
[c][ffffff]Dead type 5 planets are only found in The Wastelands.[-][/c]

Découvrez ce qui s'est passé sur les planètes mortes en collectant les journaux de bord de chacun des 6 types de planètes mortes.
Vous devrez visiter chaque type de planète morte et les planètes de démarrage ne comptent pas.
Les planètes mortes sont plus courantes dans les systèmes stellaires de classe D et K.
[c][ffffff]Les planètes mortes de type 5 ne se trouvent que dans les Terres brûlées.[-][/c]
